Filter papers by March 2021 submission date "keyword">and relevance march_2021_papers = [] relevant_keywords = [ &#x27;multiwavelength', 'multi-wavelength', 'x-ray', 'time profile', 'light curve', &#x27;simultaneous', 'counterpart', 'observation', 'detection', 'magnetar', &#x27;sgr', 'soft gamma repeater', 'burst', 'emission', 'spectrum' ] "keyword">for paper "keyword">in unique_papers.values(): published_date = paper[&#x27;published'] # Parse the date (arXiv format: 2021-03-15T17:59:59Z) "keyword">try: "keyword">if published_date "keyword">and published_date != &#x27;No date': # Extract year "keyword">and month "keyword">from date string "keyword">if published_date.startswith(&#x27;2021-03'): # Check "keyword">if the paper "keyword">is actually about FRB multiwavelength observations title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper[&#x27;summary'].lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' # Count relevant keywords relevance_score = sum(1 "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in relevant_keywords "keyword">if keyword "keyword">in combined_text) # Check "keyword">for FRB terms frb_terms = [&#x27;fast radio burst', 'frb', 'radio burst'] has_frb_terms = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in frb_terms) paper[&#x27;relevance_score'] = relevance_score paper[&#x27;has_frb_terms'] = has_frb_terms # Include "keyword">if it has FRB terms "keyword">and some relevance "keyword">if has_frb_terms "keyword">or relevance_score > 1: march_2021_papers.append(paper) print(f&#x27;âœ“ March 2021 FRB paper found: "{paper["title"][:80]}..."') print(f&#x27; Published: {published_date}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}') print(f&#x27; Has FRB terms: {has_frb_terms}') print(f&#x27; Relevance score: {relevance_score}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {paper.get("categories", [])[:3]}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"][:3])}{"..." "keyword">if len(paper["authors"]) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') # Check "keyword">for X-ray "keyword">and time profile keywords specifically has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) "keyword">if has_xray: print(f&#x27; *** CONTAINS X-RAY TERMS ***') "keyword">if has_time_profile: print(f&#x27; *** CONTAINS TIME PROFILE TERMS ***') print() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error parsing date "keyword">for paper: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue print(f&#x27;\n=== MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS SUMMARY ===') print(f&#x27;Relevant FRB papers "keyword">from March 2021: {len(march_2021_papers)}') "keyword">if march_2021_papers: # Sort by relevance score march_2021_papers.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) # Save March 2021 papers "keyword">for detailed analysis march_papers_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json') "keyword">with open(march_papers_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump({ &#x27;search_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;total_papers_found': len(all_papers), &#x27;unique_papers_count': len(unique_papers), &#x27;march_2021_papers_count': len(march_2021_papers), &#x27;search_queries_used': search_queries, &#x27;relevance_keywords': relevant_keywords, &#x27;march_2021_papers': march_2021_papers }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;âœ“ March 2021 FRB papers saved to: {march_papers_file}') # Display detailed summary of March 2021 papers print(f&#x27;\n=== MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS DETAILED ANALYSIS ===') papers_with_xray = [] papers_with_time_profile = [] papers_with_multiwavelength = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(march_2021_papers, 1): print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Title: {paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper["published"]}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}') print(f&#x27; PDF: {paper["pdf_url"]}') print(f&#x27; Relevance Score: {paper.get("relevance_score", 0)}') # Analyze content "keyword">for specific terms title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper[&#x27;summary'].lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' # Check "keyword">for key terms has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) has_multiwavelength = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;multiwavelength', 'multi-wavelength', 'simultaneous']) key_features = [] "keyword">if has_xray: key_features.append(&#x27;X-ray') papers_with_xray.append(paper) "keyword">if has_time_profile: key_features.append(&#x27;Time Profile') papers_with_time_profile.append(paper) "keyword">if has_multiwavelength: key_features.append(&#x27;Multiwavelength') papers_with_multiwavelength.append(paper) "keyword">if key_features: print(f&#x27; *** KEY FEATURES: {', '.join(key_features)} ***') print(f&#x27; Summary preview: {paper["summary"][:300]}...') # Show matching search queries "keyword">if available "keyword">if &#x27;matching_queries' "keyword">in paper: print(f&#x27; Matched queries: {", ".join(paper["matching_queries"][:3])}{"..." "keyword">if len(paper.get("matching_queries", [])) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') # Summary of papers "keyword">with key features print(f&#x27;\n=== FEATURE ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with X-ray content: {len(papers_with_xray)}') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with time profile content: {len(papers_with_time_profile)}') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with multiwavelength content: {len(papers_with_multiwavelength)}') # Identify the most promising papers "keyword">for X-ray time profile diagrams promising_papers = [] "keyword">for paper "keyword">in march_2021_papers: title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper[&#x27;summary'].lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) "keyword">if has_xray "keyword">and has_time_profile: promising_papers.append(paper) "keyword">if promising_papers: print(f&#x27;\nðŸŽ¯ MOST PROMISING PAPERS (X-ray + Time Profile): {len(promising_papers)}') "keyword">for paper "keyword">in promising_papers: print(f&#x27; - {paper["title"]} ({paper["arxiv_id"]})') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"][:3])}{"..." "keyword">if len(paper["authors"]) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') print(f&#x27;\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Found {len(march_2021_papers)} relevant FRB papers "keyword">from March 2021') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Identified {len(papers_with_xray)} papers "keyword">with X-ray content') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Identified {len(papers_with_time_profile)} papers "keyword">with time profile content') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Ready to analyze paper content "keyword">for X-ray time profile diagrams') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Author information extracted "keyword">for finding related July 2020 papers') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nâš  No relevant FRB papers found "keyword">from March 2021') print(&#x27;Saving all search results "keyword">for further analysis') # Save all search results "keyword">for analysis all_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;arxiv_frb_search_results.json') "keyword">with open(all_results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump({ &#x27;search_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;total_papers_found': len(all_papers), &#x27;unique_papers_count': len(unique_papers), &#x27;search_queries_used': search_queries, &#x27;sample_papers': list(unique_papers.values())[:10] # Save first 10 "keyword">for inspection }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;All search results saved to: {all_results_file}') print(&#x27;Consider expanding date range "keyword">or refining search terms') print(&#x27;\n*** ARXIV FRB SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ***')

mapping Location: Challenger Deep, Marianas Trench PRESSURE CONDITIONS: Hydrostatic Pressure: 1,086 bars (15,750 psi) Pressure Calculation: Approximately 1,000 times atmospheric pressure at sea level (34-39Â°F) Typical Range: 1-4 degrees Celsius Thermal Source: Geothermal vents can reach 400Â°C+ locally Ambient Conditions: Near-freezing temperatures in most areas Variation Note: Temperature varies by location and proximity to hydrothermal vents ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS: Salinity: Slightly higher than surface due to pressure Oxygen Levels: Very low dissolved oxygen Light Penetration: Complete darkness (aphotic zone) Water Density: Increased due to extreme pressure === PEAK CONDITIONS SUMMARY === MAXIMUM DEPTH: 10,994 meters (36,070 feet) - Challenger Deep PEAK PRESSURE: 1,086 bars (15,750 ðŸ“ Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">import xml.etree.ElementTree "keyword">as ET "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== SEARCHING ARXIV FOR MULTIWAVELENGTH FRB PAPERS FROM MARCH 2021 ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Find papers on multiwavelength observations of fast radio bursts "keyword">from March 2021') print(&#x27;Focus: Papers "keyword">with X-ray time profile diagrams "keyword">or similar visualizations\n') # Ensure workspace exists workspace = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok="keyword">True) # arXiv API base URL arxiv_base_url = &#x27;http://export.arxiv.org/api/query' # Comprehensive search queries "keyword">for FRB multiwavelength observations search_queries = [ &#x27;fast radio burst AND multiwavelength', &#x27;FRB AND X-ray', &#x27;fast radio burst AND X-ray', &#x27;FRB AND multiwavelength', &#x27;fast radio burst AND time profile', &#x27;FRB AND time profile', &#x27;fast radio burst AND observation', &#x27;FRB 180916 OR FRB 121102 OR FRB 200428', # Known repeating FRBs &#x27;magnetar AND fast radio burst', &#x27;SGR AND fast radio burst', &#x27;fast radio burst AND simultaneous', &#x27;FRB AND simultaneous', &#x27;fast radio burst AND counterpart', &#x27;FRB AND counterpart' ] print(f&#x27;Using {len(search_queries)} targeted search queries "keyword">for FRB research\n') all_papers = [] search_results = {} "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;Search {i}/{len(search_queries)}: "{query}"') # Search parameters "keyword">for arXiv API params = { &#x27;search_query': f'all:{query}', &#x27;start': 0, &#x27;max_results': 50, # Reasonable limit per query &#x27;sortBy': 'submittedDate', &#x27;sortOrder': 'descending' } "keyword">try: response = requests.get(arxiv_base_url, params=params, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Status code: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Parse XML response "keyword">try: root = ET.fromstring(response.text) # Define XML namespaces namespaces = { &#x27;atom': 'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom', &#x27;arxiv': 'http://arxiv.org/schemas/atom' } entries = root.findall(&#x27;atom:entry', namespaces) print(f&#x27;Found {len(entries)} papers "keyword">for query "{query}"') query_papers = [] "keyword">for entry "keyword">in entries: # Extract paper details title_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:title', namespaces) title = title_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if title_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No title' summary_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:summary', namespaces) summary = summary_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if summary_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No summary' published_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:published', namespaces) published = published_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if published_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No date' # Get arXiv ID "keyword">and PDF link id_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:id', namespaces) arxiv_id = id_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if id_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No ID' # Extract arXiv ID "keyword">from URL "keyword">if &#x27;arxiv.org/abs/' "keyword">in arxiv_id: arxiv_id = arxiv_id.split(&#x27;/')[-1] # Construct PDF URL pdf_url = f&#x27;https://arxiv.org/pdf/{arxiv_id}.pdf' # Get authors authors = [] author_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:author', namespaces) "keyword">for author_elem "keyword">in author_elems: name_elem = author_elem.find(&#x27;atom:name', namespaces) "keyword">if name_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: authors.append(name_elem.text.strip()) # Get categories categories = [] category_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:category', namespaces) "keyword">for cat_elem "keyword">in category_elems: term = cat_elem.get(&#x27;term') "keyword">if term: categories.append(term) paper_info = { &#x27;title': title, &#x27;authors': authors, &#x27;summary': summary, &#x27;published': published, &#x27;arxiv_id': arxiv_id, &#x27;pdf_url': pdf_url, &#x27;categories': categories, &#x27;search_query': query } query_papers.append(paper_info) all_papers.append(paper_info) search_results[query] = query_papers print(f&#x27;âœ“ Extracted {len(query_papers)} papers "keyword">from XML') "keyword">except ET.ParseError "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error parsing XML "keyword">for query "{query}": {str(e)}') "keyword">continue "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;Failed to search arXiv: {response.status_code}') "keyword">continue "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching "keyword">for "{query}": {str(e)}') "keyword">continue # Small delay between requests to be respectful to arXiv time.sleep(0.5) print() print(f&#x27;=== FILTERING PAPERS BY MARCH 2021 AND RELEVANCE ===') print(f&#x27;Total papers found across all queries: {len(all_papers)}') # Remove duplicates based on arXiv ID unique_papers = {} "keyword">for paper "keyword">in all_papers: arxiv_id = paper[&#x27;arxiv_id'] "keyword">if arxiv_id "keyword">not "keyword">in unique_papers: unique_papers[arxiv_id] = paper "keyword">else: # Keep track of multiple matching queries existing_queries = unique_papers[arxiv_id].get(&#x27;matching_queries', [unique_papers[arxiv_id]['search_query']]) new_queries = existing_queries + [paper[&#x27;search_query']] unique_papers[arxiv_id][&#x27;matching_queries'] = list(set(new_queries)) print(f&#x27;Unique papers after deduplication: {len(unique_papers)}') # Filter papers by March 2021 submission date "keyword">and relevance march_2021_papers = [] relevant_keywords = [ &#x27;multiwavelength', 'multi-wavelength', 'x-ray', 'time profile', 'light curve', &#x27;simultaneous', 'counterpart', 'observation', 'detection', 'magnetar', &#x27;sgr', 'soft gamma repeater', 'burst', 'emission', 'spectrum' ] "keyword">for paper "keyword">in unique_papers.values(): published_date = paper[&#x27;published'] # Parse the date (arXiv format: 2021-03-15T17:59:59Z) "keyword">try: "keyword">if published_date "keyword">and published_date != &#x27;No date': # Extract year "keyword">and month "keyword">from date string "keyword">if published_date.startswith(&#x27;2021-03'): # Check "keyword">if the paper "keyword">is actually about FRB multiwavelength observations title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper[&#x27;summary'].lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' # Count relevant keywords relevance_score = sum(1 "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in relevant_keywords "keyword">if keyword "keyword">in combined_text) # Check "keyword">for FRB terms frb_terms = [&#x27;fast radio burst', 'frb', 'radio burst'] has_frb_terms = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in frb_terms) paper[&#x27;relevance_score'] = relevance_score paper[&#x27;has_frb_terms'] = has_frb_terms # Include "keyword">if it has FRB terms "keyword">and some relevance "keyword">if has_frb_terms "keyword">or relevance_score > 1: march_2021_papers.append(paper) print(f&#x27;âœ“ March 2021 FRB paper found: "{paper["title"][:80]}..."') print(f&#x27; Published: {published_date}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}') print(f&#x27; Has FRB terms: {has_frb_terms}') print(f&#x27; Relevance score: {relevance_score}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {paper.get("categories", [])[:3]}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"][:3])}{"." "keyword">if len(paper["authors"]) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') # Check "keyword">for X-ray "keyword">and time profile keywords specifically has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) "keyword">if has_xray: print(f&#x27; *** CONTAINS X-RAY TERMS ***') "keyword">if has_time_profile: print(f&#x27; *** CONTAINS TIME PROFILE TERMS ***') print() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error parsing date "keyword">for paper: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue print(f&#x27;\n=== MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS SUMMARY ===') print(f&#x27;Relevant FRB papers "keyword">from March 2021: {len(march_2021_papers)}') "keyword">if march_2021_papers: # Sort by relevance score march_2021_papers.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) # Save March 2021 papers "keyword">for detailed analysis march_papers_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json') "keyword">with open(march_papers_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump({ &#x27;search_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;total_papers_found': len(all_papers), &#x27;unique_papers_count': len(unique_papers), &#x27;march_2021_papers_count': len(march_2021_papers), &#x27;search_queries_used': search_queries, &#x27;relevance_keywords': relevant_keywords, &#x27;march_2021_papers': march_2021_papers }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;âœ“ March 2021 FRB papers saved to: {march_papers_file}') # Display detailed summary of March 2021 papers print(f&#x27;\n=== MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS DETAILED ANALYSIS ===') papers_with_xray = [] papers_with_time_profile = [] papers_with_multiwavelength = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(march_2021_papers, 1): print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Title: {paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper["published"]}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}') print(f&#x27; PDF: {paper["pdf_url"]}') print(f&#x27; Relevance Score: {paper.get("relevance_score", 0)}') # Analyze content "keyword">for specific terms title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper[&#x27;summary'].lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' # Check "keyword">for key terms has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) has_multiwavelength = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;multiwavelength', 'multi-wavelength', 'simultaneous']) key_features = [] "keyword">if has_xray: key_features.append(&#x27;X-ray') papers_with_xray.append(paper) "keyword">if has_time_profile: key_features.append(&#x27;Time Profile') papers_with_time_profile.append(paper) "keyword">if has_multiwavelength: key_features.append(&#x27;Multiwavelength') papers_with_multiwavelength.append(paper) "keyword">if key_features: print(f&#x27; *** KEY FEATURES: {", ".join(key_features)} ***') print(f&#x27; Summary preview: {paper["summary"][:300]}...') # Show matching search queries "keyword">if available "keyword">if &#x27;matching_queries' "keyword">in paper: print(f&#x27; Matched queries: {", ".join(paper["matching_queries"][:3])}{"." "keyword">if len(paper.get("matching_queries", [])) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') # Summary of papers "keyword">with key features print(f&#x27;\n=== FEATURE ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with X-ray content: {len(papers_with_xray)}') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with time profile content: {len(papers_with_time_profile)}') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with multiwavelength content: {len(papers_with_multiwavelength)}') # Identify the most promising papers "keyword">for X-ray time profile diagrams promising_papers = [] "keyword">for paper "keyword">in march_2021_papers: title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper[&#x27;summary'].lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) "keyword">if has_xray "keyword">and has_time_profile: promising_papers.append(paper) "keyword">if promising_papers: print(f&#x27;\nðŸŽ¯ MOST PROMISING PAPERS (X-ray + Time Profile): {len(promising_papers)}') "keyword">for paper "keyword">in promising_papers: print(f&#x27; - {paper["title"]} ({paper["arxiv_id"]})') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"][:3])}{"." "keyword">if len(paper["authors"]) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') print(f&#x27;\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Found {len(march_2021_papers)} relevant FRB papers "keyword">from March 2021') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Identified {len(papers_with_xray)} papers "keyword">with X-ray content') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Identified {len(papers_with_time_profile)} papers "keyword">with time profile content') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Ready to analyze paper content "keyword">for X-ray time profile diagrams') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Author information extracted "keyword">for finding related July 2020 papers') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nâš  No relevant FRB papers found "keyword">from March 2021') print(&#x27;Saving all search results "keyword">for further analysis') # Save all search results "keyword">for analysis all_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;arxiv_frb_search_results.json') "keyword">with open(all_results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump({ &#x27;search_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;total_papers_found': len(all_papers), &#x27;unique_papers_count': len(unique_papers), &#x27;search_queries_used': search_queries, &#x27;sample_papers': list(unique_papers.values())[:10] # Save first 10 "keyword">for inspection }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;All search results saved to: {all_results_file}') print(&#x27;Consider expanding date range "keyword">or refining search terms') print(&#x27;\n*** ARXIV FRB SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ***')
ðŸ“„ Output
Code Output: === SEARCHING ARXIV FOR MULTIWAVELENGTH FRB PAPERS FROM MARCH 2021 === Objective: Find papers on multiwavelength observations of fast radio bursts from March 2021 Focus: Papers with X-ray tester Code Testing
2025-08-14 03:15:23

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and successfully completed the **PLAN** requirements. The script properly searched arXiv using 14 comprehensive search queries targeting FRB research, processed 618 total papers, deduplicated to 422 unique papers, and successfully identified 1 relevant FRB paper from March 2021: 'Multiwavelength observations of Fast Radio Bursts' by Nicastro et al. (arXiv ID: 2103.07786v2). The paper has a high relevance score (8) and contains multiwavelength content as specified in the **PLAN**. Author information was extracted (Luciano Nicastro, Cristiano Guidorzi, Eliana Palazzi, etc.) which establishes the foundation for finding related July 2020 papers by the same authors. The results were properly saved to 'workspace/arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json' for future analysis. **PLAN** alignment: 100% complete. The search successfully found the target March 2021 FRB paper with multiwavelength observations, though it noted no papers specifically contained both X-ray and time profile terms in the abstracts. Next step: Analyze the found paper's PDF content to look for X-ray time profile diagrams and search for related July 2020 papers by the same authors.

ðŸ“ Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">import xml.etree.ElementTree "keyword">as ET "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== SEARCHING ARXIV FOR MULTIWAVELENGTH FRB PAPERS FROM MARCH 2021 ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Find papers on multiwavelength observations of fast radio bursts "keyword">from March 2021') print(&#x27;Focus: Papers "keyword">with X-ray time profile diagrams "keyword">or similar visualizations\n') # Ensure workspace exists workspace = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok="keyword">True) # arXiv API base URL arxiv_base_url = &#x27;http://export.arxiv.org/api/query' # Comprehensive search queries "keyword">for FRB multiwavelength observations search_queries = [ &#x27;fast radio burst AND multiwavelength', &#x27;FRB AND X-ray', &#x27;fast radio burst AND X-ray', &#x27;FRB AND multiwavelength', &#x27;fast radio burst AND time profile', &#x27;FRB AND time profile', &#x27;fast radio burst AND observation', &#x27;FRB 180916 OR FRB 121102 OR FRB 200428', # Known repeating FRBs &#x27;magnetar AND fast radio burst', &#x27;SGR AND fast radio burst', &#x27;fast radio burst AND simultaneous', &#x27;FRB AND simultaneous', &#x27;fast radio burst AND counterpart', &#x27;FRB AND counterpart' ] print(f&#x27;Using {len(search_queries)} targeted search queries "keyword">for FRB research\n') all_papers = [] search_results = {} "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;Search {i}/{len(search_queries)}: "{query}"') # Search parameters "keyword">for arXiv API params = { &#x27;search_query': f'all:{query}', &#x27;start': 0, &#x27;max_results': 50, # Reasonable limit per query &#x27;sortBy': 'submittedDate', &#x27;sortOrder': 'descending' } "keyword">try: response = requests.get(arxiv_base_url, params=params, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Status code: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Parse XML response "keyword">try: root = ET.fromstring(response.text) # Define XML namespaces namespaces = { &#x27;atom': 'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom', &#x27;arxiv': 'http://arxiv.org/schemas/atom' } entries = root.findall(&#x27;atom:entry', namespaces) print(f&#x27;Found {len(entries)} papers "keyword">for query "{query}"') query_papers = [] "keyword">for entry "keyword">in entries: # Extract paper details title_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:title', namespaces) title = title_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if title_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No title' summary_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:summary', namespaces) summary = summary_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if summary_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No summary' published_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:published', namespaces) published = published_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if published_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No date' # Get arXiv ID "keyword">and PDF link id_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:id', namespaces) arxiv_id = id_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if id_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No ID' # Extract arXiv ID "keyword">from URL "keyword">if &#x27;arxiv.org/abs/' "keyword">in arxiv_id: arxiv_id = arxiv_id.split(&#x27;/')[-1] # Construct PDF URL pdf_url = f&#x27;https://arxiv.org/pdf/{arxiv_id}.pdf' # Get authors authors = [] author_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:author', namespaces) "keyword">for author_elem "keyword">in author_elems: name_elem = author_elem.find(&#x27;atom:name', namespaces) "keyword">if name_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: authors.append(name_elem.text.strip()) # Get categories categories = [] category_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:category', namespaces) "keyword">for cat_elem "keyword">in category_elems: term = cat_elem.get(&#x27;term') "keyword">if term: categories.append(term) paper_info = { &#x27;title': title, &#x27;authors': authors, &#x27;summary': summary, &#x27;published': published, &#x27;arxiv_id': arxiv_id, &#x27;pdf_url': pdf_url, &#x27;categories': categories, &#x27;search_query': query } query_papers.append(paper_info) all_papers.append(paper_info) search_results[query] = query_papers print(f&#x27;âœ“ Extracted {len(query_papers)} papers "keyword">from XML') "keyword">except ET.ParseError "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error parsing XML "keyword">for query "{query}": {str(e)}') "keyword">continue "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;Failed to search arXiv: {response.status_code}') "keyword">continue "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching "keyword">for "{query}": {str(e)}') "keyword">continue # Small delay between requests to be respectful to arXiv time.sleep(0.5) print() print(f&#x27;=== FILTERING PAPERS BY MARCH 2021 AND RELEVANCE ===') print(f&#x27;Total papers found across all queries: {len(all_papers)}') # Remove duplicates based on arXiv ID unique_papers = {} "keyword">for paper "keyword">in all_papers: arxiv_id = paper[&#x27;arxiv_id'] "keyword">if arxiv_id "keyword">not "keyword">in unique_papers: unique_papers[arxiv_id] = paper "keyword">else: # Keep track of multiple matching queries existing_queries = unique_papers[arxiv_id].get(&#x27;matching_queries', [unique_papers[arxiv_id]['search_query']]) new_queries = existing_queries + [paper[&#x27;search_query']] unique_papers[arxiv_id][&#x27;matching_queries'] = list(set(new_queries)) print(f&#x27;Unique papers after deduplication: {len(unique_papers)}') # Filter papers by March 2021 submission date "keyword">and relevance march_2021_papers = [] relevant_keywords = [ &#x27;multiwavelength', 'multi-wavelength', 'x-ray', 'time profile', 'light curve', &#x27;simultaneous', 'counterpart', 'observation', 'detection', 'magnetar', &#x27;sgr', 'soft gamma repeater', 'burst', 'emission', 'spectrum' ] "keyword">for paper "keyword">in unique_papers.values(): published_date = paper[&#x27;published'] # Parse the date (arXiv format: 2021-03-15T17:59:59Z) "keyword">try: "keyword">if published_date "keyword">and published_date != &#x27;No date': # Extract year "keyword">and month "keyword">from date string "keyword">if published_date.startswith(&#x27;2021-03'): # Check "keyword">if the paper "keyword">is actually about FRB multiwavelength observations title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper[&#x27;summary'].lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' # Count relevant keywords relevance_score = sum(1 "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in relevant_keywords "keyword">if keyword "keyword">in combined_text) # Check "keyword">for FRB terms frb_terms = [&#x27;fast radio burst', 'frb', 'radio burst'] has_frb_terms = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in frb_terms) paper[&#x27;relevance_score'] = relevance_score paper[&#x27;has_frb_terms'] = has_frb_terms # Include "keyword">if it has FRB terms "keyword">and some relevance "keyword">if has_frb_terms "keyword">or relevance_score > 1: march_2021_papers.append(paper) print(f&#x27;âœ“ March 2021 FRB paper found: "{paper["title"][:80]}..."') print(f&#x27; Published: {published_date}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}') print(f&#x27; Has FRB terms: {has_frb_terms}') print(f&#x27; Relevance score: {relevance_score}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {paper.get("categories", [])[:3]}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"][:3])}{"." "keyword">if len(paper["authors"]) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') # Check "keyword">for X-ray "keyword">and time profile keywords specifically has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) "keyword">if has_xray: print(f&#x27; *** CONTAINS X-RAY TERMS ***') "keyword">if has_time_profile: print(f&#x27; *** CONTAINS TIME PROFILE TERMS ***') print() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error parsing date "keyword">for paper: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue print(f&#x27;\n=== MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS SUMMARY ===') print(f&#x27;Relevant FRB papers "keyword">from March 2021: {len(march_2021_papers)}') "keyword">if march_2021_papers: # Sort by relevance score march_2021_papers.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) # Save March 2021 papers "keyword">for detailed analysis march_papers_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json') "keyword">with open(march_papers_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump({ &#x27;search_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;total_papers_found': len(all_papers), &#x27;unique_papers_count': len(unique_papers), &#x27;march_2021_papers_count': len(march_2021_papers), &#x27;search_queries_used': search_queries, &#x27;relevance_keywords': relevant_keywords, &#x27;march_2021_papers': march_2021_papers }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;âœ“ March 2021 FRB papers saved to: {march_papers_file}') # Display detailed summary of March 2021 papers print(f&#x27;\n=== MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS DETAILED ANALYSIS ===') papers_with_xray = [] papers_with_time_profile = [] papers_with_multiwavelength = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(march_2021_papers, 1): print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Title: {paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper["published"]}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}') print(f&#x27; PDF: {paper["pdf_url"]}') print(f&#x27; Relevance Score: {paper.get("relevance_score", 0)}') # Analyze content "keyword">for specific terms title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper[&#x27;summary'].lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' # Check "keyword">for key terms has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) has_multiwavelength = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;multiwavelength', 'multi-wavelength', 'simultaneous']) key_features = [] "keyword">if has_xray: key_features.append(&#x27;X-ray') papers_with_xray.append(paper) "keyword">if has_time_profile: key_features.append(&#x27;Time Profile') papers_with_time_profile.append(paper) "keyword">if has_multiwavelength: key_features.append(&#x27;Multiwavelength') papers_with_multiwavelength.append(paper) "keyword">if key_features: print(f&#x27; *** KEY FEATURES: {", ".join(key_features)} ***') print(f&#x27; Summary preview: {paper["summary"][:300]}...') # Show matching search queries "keyword">if available "keyword">if &#x27;matching_queries' "keyword">in paper: print(f&#x27; Matched queries: {", ".join(paper["matching_queries"][:3])}{"." "keyword">if len(paper.get("matching_queries", [])) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') # Summary of papers "keyword">with key features print(f&#x27;\n=== FEATURE ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with X-ray content: {len(papers_with_xray)}') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with time profile content: {len(papers_with_time_profile)}') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with multiwavelength content: {len(papers_with_multiwavelength)}') # Identify the most promising papers "keyword">for X-ray time profile diagrams promising_papers = [] "keyword">for paper "keyword">in march_2021_papers: title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper[&#x27;summary'].lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) "keyword">if has_xray "keyword">and has_time_profile: promising_papers.append(paper) "keyword">if promising_papers: print(f&#x27;\nðŸŽ¯ MOST PROMISING PAPERS (X-ray + Time Profile): {len(promising_papers)}') "keyword">for paper "keyword">in promising_papers: print(f&#x27; - {paper["title"]} ({paper["arxiv_id"]})') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"][:3])}{"." "keyword">if len(paper["authors"]) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') print(f&#x27;\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Found {len(march_2021_papers)} relevant FRB papers "keyword">from March 2021') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Identified {len(papers_with_xray)} papers "keyword">with X-ray content') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Identified {len(papers_with_time_profile)} papers "keyword">with time profile content') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Ready to analyze paper content "keyword">for X-ray time profile diagrams') print(f&#x27;âœ“ Author information extracted "keyword">for finding related July 2020 papers') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nâš  No relevant FRB papers found "keyword">from March 2021') print(&#x27;Saving all search results "keyword">for further analysis') # Save all search results "keyword">for analysis all_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;arxiv_frb_search_results.json') "keyword">with open(all_results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump({ &#x27;search_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;total_papers_found': len(all_papers), &#x27;unique_papers_count': len(unique_papers), &#x27;search_queries_used': search_queries, &#x27;sample_papers': list(unique_papers.values())[:10] # Save first 10 "keyword">for inspection }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;All search results saved to: {all_results_file}') print(&#x27;Consider expanding date range "keyword">or refining search terms') print(&#x27;\n*** ARXIV FRB SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ***')

ðŸ“ Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time print(&#x27;=== ANALYZING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPER AND SEARCHING FOR JULY 2020 RELATED WORK ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Analyze the found March 2021 paper "keyword">and search "keyword">for related July 2020 papers by same authors') print(&#x27;Focus: Look "keyword">for X-ray time profile diagrams "keyword">and establish author connections\n') # First, let's inspect the workspace structure workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace = workspace_dirs[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace}') "keyword">else: workspace = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;Created new workspace directory: {workspace}') print(f&#x27;\nWorkspace contents:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace): file_path = os.path.join(workspace, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Load "keyword">and inspect the March 2021 FRB papers data march_papers_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(march_papers_file): print(f&#x27;\n=== INSPECTING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS DATA ===') "keyword">with open(march_papers_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: march_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;March 2021 data structure:') "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in march_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {value}') # Extract the March 2021 paper details march_papers = march_data.get(&#x27;march_2021_papers', []) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(march_papers)} March 2021 FRB papers') "keyword">if march_papers: target_paper = march_papers[0] # The Nicastro et al. paper print(f&#x27;\n=== TARGET MARCH 2021 PAPER DETAILS ===') print(f&#x27;Title: {target_paper.get("title", "No title")}') print(f&#x27;arXiv ID: {target_paper.get("arxiv_id", "No ID")}') print(f&#x27;Published: {target_paper.get("published", "No date")}') print(f&#x27;Authors: {", ".join(target_paper.get("authors", []))}') print(f&#x27;Categories: {", ".join(target_paper.get("categories", []))}') print(f&#x27;PDF URL: {target_paper.get("pdf_url", "No URL")}') print(f&#x27;Relevance Score: {target_paper.get("relevance_score", 0)}') print(f&#x27;Has FRB terms: {target_paper.get("has_frb_terms", "keyword">False)}') print(f&#x27;\nSummary:') print(target_paper.get(&#x27;summary', 'No summary')[:500] + '...') # Extract author information "keyword">for July 2020 search authors = target_paper.get(&#x27;authors', []) print(f&#x27;\n=== AUTHOR ANALYSIS FOR JULY 2020 SEARCH ===') print(f&#x27;Total authors: {len(authors)}') print(&#x27;Author list:') "keyword">for i, author "keyword">in enumerate(authors, 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. {author}') # Prepare search terms "keyword">for July 2020 papers by same authors primary_authors = authors[:3] # Focus on first 3 authors print(f&#x27;\nPrimary authors "keyword">for July 2020 search: {", ".join(primary_authors)}') # Download the March 2021 paper PDF "keyword">for analysis pdf_url = target_paper.get(&#x27;pdf_url') "keyword">if pdf_url: print(f&#x27;\n=== DOWNLOADING MARCH 2021 PAPER PDF ===') print(f&#x27;PDF URL: {pdf_url}') "keyword">try: headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } pdf_response = requests.get(pdf_url, headers=headers, timeout=60) "keyword">if pdf_response.status_code == 200: pdf_filename = os.path.join(workspace, f&#x27;march_2021_frb_paper_{target_paper.get("arxiv_id", "unknown").replace(".", "_")}.pdf') "keyword">with open(pdf_filename, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(pdf_response.content) pdf_size = len(pdf_response.content) print(f&#x27;âœ“ PDF downloaded successfully: {pdf_filename}') print(f&#x27; File size: {pdf_size:,} bytes') # Note: For actual PDF analysis, we would need additional libraries like PyPDF2 "keyword">or pdfplumber # For now, we'll focus on the text-based search approach "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;âœ— Failed to download PDF: HTTP {pdf_response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;âœ— Error downloading PDF: {str(e)}') # Now search "keyword">for July 2020 papers by the same authors print(f&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS ===') # arXiv API base URL arxiv_base_url = &#x27;http://export.arxiv.org/api/query' # Create search queries "keyword">for each primary author july_2020_queries = [] # Search by individual authors "keyword">for author "keyword">in primary_authors: # Try different name formats author_parts = author.split() "keyword">if len(author_parts) >= 2: # Full name july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{author}"') # Last name, first initial last_name = author_parts[-1] first_initial = author_parts[0][0] "keyword">if author_parts[0] "keyword">else &#x27;' july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{last_name}, {first_initial}"') # Just last name (broader search) july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{last_name}"') # Also search "keyword">for combinations "keyword">with FRB terms "keyword">for author "keyword">in primary_authors[:2]: # Limit to avoid too many queries july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{author}" AND (fast radio burst OR FRB)') print(f&#x27;Using {len(july_2020_queries)} author-based search queries') all_july_2020_papers = [] "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(july_2020_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;\nSearch {i}/{len(july_2020_queries)}: "{query}"') params = { &#x27;search_query': query, &#x27;start': 0, &#x27;max_results': 30, # Reasonable limit &#x27;sortBy': 'submittedDate', &#x27;sortOrder': 'descending' } "keyword">try: response = requests.get(arxiv_base_url, params=params, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: "keyword">import xml.etree.ElementTree "keyword">as ET root = ET.fromstring(response.text) namespaces = { &#x27;atom': 'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom', &#x27;arxiv': 'http://arxiv.org/schemas/atom' } entries = root.findall(&#x27;atom:entry', namespaces) print(f&#x27; Found {len(entries)} papers') july_2020_count = 0 "keyword">for entry "keyword">in entries: # Extract paper details title_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:title', namespaces) title = title_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if title_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No title' published_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:published', namespaces) published = published_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if published_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No date' # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is "keyword">from July 2020 "keyword">if published.startswith(&#x27;2020-07'): july_2020_count += 1 # Extract full paper details "keyword">for July 2020 papers summary_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:summary', namespaces) summary = summary_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if summary_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No summary' id_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:id', namespaces) arxiv_id = id_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if id_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No ID' "keyword">if &#x27;arxiv.org/abs/' "keyword">in arxiv_id: arxiv_id = arxiv_id.split(&#x27;/')[-1] # Get authors paper_authors = [] author_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:author', namespaces) "keyword">for author_elem "keyword">in author_elems: name_elem = author_elem.find(&#x27;atom:name', namespaces) "keyword">if name_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: paper_authors.append(name_elem.text.strip()) # Get categories categories = [] category_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:category', namespaces) "keyword">for cat_elem "keyword">in category_elems: term = cat_elem.get(&#x27;term') "keyword">if term: categories.append(term) july_paper = { &#x27;title': title, &#x27;authors': paper_authors, &#x27;summary': summary, &#x27;published': published, &#x27;arxiv_id': arxiv_id, &#x27;pdf_url': f'https://arxiv.org/pdf/{arxiv_id}.pdf', &#x27;categories': categories, &#x27;search_query': query } all_july_2020_papers.append(july_paper) print(f&#x27; âœ“ July 2020 paper: "{title[:60]}..." ({arxiv_id})') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper_authors[:2])}{"." "keyword">if len(paper_authors) > 2 "keyword">else ""}') print(f&#x27; July 2020 papers found: {july_2020_count}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; Error: HTTP {response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Exception: {str(e)}') # Small delay between requests time.sleep(0.5) # Remove duplicates "keyword">and analyze July 2020 papers unique_july_2020_papers = {} "keyword">for paper "keyword">in all_july_2020_papers: arxiv_id = paper[&#x27;arxiv_id'] "keyword">if arxiv_id "keyword">not "keyword">in unique_july_2020_papers: unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id] = paper july_2020_papers_list = list(unique_july_2020_papers.values()) print(f&#x27;\n=== JULY 2020 PAPERS ANALYSIS ===') print(f&#x27;Total July 2020 papers found: {len(july_2020_papers_list)}') "keyword">if july_2020_papers_list: print(f&#x27;\n=== JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS ===') # Check which papers have overlapping authors "keyword">with the March 2021 paper march_authors_lower = [author.lower() "keyword">for author "keyword">in authors] related_papers = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(july_2020_papers_list, 1): paper_authors_lower = [author.lower() "keyword">for author "keyword">in paper.get(&#x27;authors', [])] # Check "keyword">for author overlap author_overlap = any(march_author "keyword">in paper_authors_lower "keyword">for march_author "keyword">in march_authors_lower) print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Title: {paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper["published"]}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}') "keyword">if author_overlap: print(f&#x27; *** AUTHOR OVERLAP WITH MARCH 2021 PAPER ***') related_papers.append(paper) # Check "keyword">for FRB "keyword">or X-ray content title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper.get(&#x27;summary', '').lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' has_frb = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;fast radio burst', 'frb', 'radio burst']) has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) features = [] "keyword">if has_frb: features.append(&#x27;FRB') "keyword">if has_xray: features.append(&#x27;X-ray') "keyword">if has_time_profile: features.append(&#x27;Time Profile') "keyword">if features: print(f&#x27; *** FEATURES: {", ".join(features)} ***') print(f&#x27; Summary: {paper.get("summary", "No summary")[:200]}...') # Save July 2020 results july_results = { &#x27;search_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;march_2021_paper': target_paper, &#x27;july_2020_search_queries': july_2020_queries, &#x27;total_july_2020_papers': len(july_2020_papers_list), &#x27;related_papers_count': len(related_papers), &#x27;july_2020_papers': july_2020_papers_list, &#x27;related_papers': related_papers } july_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;july_2020_related_papers.json') "keyword">with open(july_results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(july_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nâœ“ July 2020 search results saved to: {july_results_file}') "keyword">if related_papers: print(f&#x27;\nðŸŽ¯ FOUND {len(related_papers)} RELATED JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS!') print(&#x27;These papers are candidates "keyword">for containing X-ray time profile diagrams.') "keyword">for paper "keyword">in related_papers: print(f&#x27;\nðŸ“„ {paper["title"]} ({paper["arxiv_id"]})') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper["published"]}') print(f&#x27; PDF: {paper["pdf_url"]}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\nâš  No July 2020 papers found "keyword">with overlapping authors') print(&#x27;Consider broader search criteria "keyword">or different time periods') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nâš  No July 2020 papers found by the same authors') print(&#x27;Consider expanding search criteria "keyword">or checking different date ranges') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nâš  No March 2021 papers found "keyword">in the data file') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\nâš  March 2021 papers file "keyword">not found: {march_papers_file}') print(f&#x27;\n=== SUMMARY ===') print(&#x27;âœ“ Analyzed March 2021 FRB paper by Nicastro et al.') print(&#x27;âœ“ Extracted author information "keyword">for related work search') print(&#x27;âœ“ Searched "keyword">for July 2020 papers by same authors') print(&#x27;âœ“ Ready "keyword">for detailed PDF analysis of promising papers') print(&#x27;\n*** ANALYSIS PHASE COMPLETE ***')
ðŸ“„ Output
Code Output: === ANALYZING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPER AND SEARCHING FOR JULY 2020 RELATED WORK === Objective: Analyze the found March 2021 paper and search for related July 2020 papers by same authors Focus: Look for X-ray time profile diagrams and establish author connections Using workspace directory: workspace_5f982798-16b9-4051-ab57-cfc7ebdb2a91 Workspace contents: - arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json (3,311 bytes) === INSPECTING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS DATA === March 2021 data structure: search_date: str = 2025-08-14T03:15:12.116876 total_papers_found: int = 618 unique_papers_count: int = 422 march_2021_papers_count: int = 1 search_queries_used: List with 14 items relevance_keywords: List with 15 items march_2021_papers: List with 1 items Found 1 March 2021 FRB papers === TARGET MARCH 2021 PAPER DETAILS === Title: Multiwavelength observations of Fast Radio Bursts arXiv ID: 2103.07786v2 Published: 2021-03-13T20:39:49Z Authors: Luciano Nicastro, Cristiano Guidorzi, Eliana Palazzi, Luca Zampieri, Massimo Turatto, Angela Gardini Categories: astro-ph.HE PDF URL: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2103.07786v2.pdf Relevance Score: 8 Has FRB terms: True Summary: The origin and phenomenology of the Fast Radio Burst (FRB) remains unknown despite more than a decade of efforts. Though several models have been proposed to explain the observed data, none is able to explain alone the variety of events so far recorded. The leading models consider magnetars as potential FRB sources. The recent detection of FRBs from the galactic magnetar SGR J1935+2154 seems to support them. Still, emission duration and energetic budget challenge all these models. Like for other... === AUTHOR ANALYSIS FOR JULY 2020 SEARCH === Total authors: 6 Author list: 1. Luciano Nicastro 2. Cristiano Guidorzi 3. Eliana Palazzi 4. Luca Zampieri 5. Massimo Turatto 6. "keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time print(&#x27;=== ANALYZING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPER AND SEARCHING FOR JULY 2020 RELATED WORK ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Analyze the found March 2021 paper "keyword">and search "keyword">for related July 2020 papers by same authors') print(&#x27;Focus: Look "keyword">for X-ray time profile diagrams "keyword">and establish author connections\n') # First, let's inspect the workspace structure workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace = workspace_dirs[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace}') "keyword">else: workspace = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;Created new workspace directory: {workspace}') print(f&#x27;\nWorkspace contents:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace): file_path = os.path.join(workspace, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Load "keyword">and inspect the March 2021 FRB papers data march_papers_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(march_papers_file): print(f&#x27;\n=== INSPECTING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS DATA ===') "keyword">with open(march_papers_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: march_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;March 2021 data structure:') "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in march_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {value}') # Extract the March 2021 paper details march_papers = march_data.get(&#x27;march_2021_papers', []) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(march_papers)} March 2021 FRB papers') "keyword">if march_papers: target_paper = march_papers[0] # Note: For actual PDF analysis, we would need additional libraries like PyPDF2 "keyword">or pdfplumber # For now, we'll focus on the text-based search approach "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;âœ— Failed to download PDF: HTTP {pdf_response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;âœ— Error downloading PDF: {str(e)}') # Now search "keyword">for July 2020 papers by the same authors print(f&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS ===') # arXiv API base URL arxiv_base_url = &#x27;http://export.arxiv.org/api/query' # Create search queries "keyword">for each primary author july_2020_queries = [] # Search by individual authors "keyword">for author "keyword">in primary_authors: # Try different name formats author_parts = author.split() "keyword">if len(author_parts) >= 2: # Full name july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{author}"') # Last name, first initial last_name = author_parts[-1] first_initial = author_parts[0][0] "keyword">if author_parts[0] "keyword">else &#x27;' july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{last_name}, {first_initial}"') # Just last name (broader search) july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{last_name}"') # Also search "keyword">for combinations "keyword">with FRB terms "keyword">for author "keyword">in primary_authors[:2]: # Limit to avoid too many queries july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{author}" AND (fast radio burst OR FRB)') print(f&#x27;Using {len(july_2020_queries)} author-based search queries') all_july_2020_papers = [] "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(july_2020_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;\nSearch {i}/{len(july_2020_queries)}: "{query}"') params = { &#x27;search_query': query, &#x27;start': 0, &#x27;max_results': 30, # Reasonable limit &#x27;sortBy': 'submittedDate', &#x27;sortOrder': 'descending' } "keyword">try: response = requests.get(arxiv_base_url, params=params, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: "keyword">import xml.etree.ElementTree "keyword">as ET root = ET.fromstring(response.text) namespaces = { &#x27;atom': 'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom', &#x27;arxiv': 'http://arxiv.org/schemas/atom' } entries = root.findall(&#x27;atom:entry', namespaces) print(f&#x27; Found {len(entries)} papers') july_2020_count = 0 "keyword">for entry "keyword">in entries: # Extract paper details title_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:title', namespaces) title = title_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if title_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No title' published_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:published', namespaces) published = published_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if published_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No date' # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is "keyword">from July 2020 "keyword">if published.startswith(&#x27;2020-07'): july_2020_count += 1 # Extract full paper details "keyword">for July 2020 papers summary_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:summary', namespaces) summary = summary_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if summary_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No summary' id_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:id', namespaces) arxiv_id = id_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if id_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No ID' "keyword">if &#x27;arxiv.org/abs/' "keyword">in arxiv_id: arxiv_id = arxiv_id.split(&#x27;/')[-1] # Get authors paper_authors = [] author_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:author', namespaces) "keyword">for author_elem "keyword">in author_elems: name_elem = author_elem.find(&#x27;atom:name', namespaces) "keyword">if name_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: paper_authors.append(name_elem.text.strip()) # Get categories categories = [] category_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:category', namespaces) "keyword">for cat_elem "keyword">in category_elems: term = cat_elem.get(&#x27;term') "keyword">if term: categories.append(term) july_paper = { &#x27;title': title, &#x27;authors': paper_authors, &#x27;summary': summary, &#x27;published': published, &#x27;arxiv_id': arxiv_id, &#x27;pdf_url': f'https://arxiv.org/pdf/{arxiv_id}.pdf', &#x27;categories': categories, &#x27;search_query': query } all_july_2020_papers.append(july_paper) print(f&#x27; âœ“ July 2020 paper: "{title[:60]}..." ({arxiv_id})') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper_authors[:2])}{"." "keyword">if len(paper_authors) > 2 "keyword">else ""}') print(f&#x27; July 2020 papers found: {july_2020_count}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; Error: HTTP {response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Exception: {str(e)}') # Small delay between requests time.sleep(0.5) # Remove duplicates "keyword">and analyze July 2020 papers unique_july_2020_papers = {} "keyword">for paper "keyword">in all_july_2020_papers: arxiv_id = paper[&#x27;arxiv_id'] "keyword">if arxiv_id "keyword">not "keyword">in unique_july_2020_papers: unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id] = paper july_2020_papers_list = list(unique_july_2020_papers.values()) print(f&#x27;\n=== JULY 2020 PAPERS ANALYSIS ===') print(f&#x27;Total July 2020 papers found: {len(july_2020_papers_list)}') "keyword">if july_2020_papers_list: print(f&#x27;\n=== JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS ===') # Check which papers have overlapping authors "keyword">with the March 2021 paper march_authors_lower = [author.lower() "keyword">for author "keyword">in authors] related_papers = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(july_2020_papers_list, 1): paper_authors_lower = [author.lower() "keyword">for author "keyword">in paper.get(&#x27;authors', [])] # Check "keyword">for author overlap author_overlap = any(march_author "keyword">in paper_authors_lower "keyword">for march_author "keyword">in march_authors_lower) print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Title: {paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper["published"]}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}') "keyword">if author_overlap: print(f&#x27; *** AUTHOR OVERLAP WITH MARCH 2021 PAPER ***') related_papers.append(paper) # Check "keyword">for FRB "keyword">or X-ray content title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper.get(&#x27;summary', '').lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' has_frb = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;fast radio burst', 'frb', 'radio burst']) has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing']) features = [] "keyword">if has_frb: features.append(&#x27;FRB') "keyword">if has_xray: features.append(&#x27;X-ray') "keyword">if has_time_profile: features.append(&#x27;Time Profile') "keyword">if features: print(f&#x27; *** FEATURES: {", ".join(features)} ***') print(f&#x27; Summary: {paper.get("summary", "No summary")[:200]}...') # Save July 2020 results july_results = { &#x27;search_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;march_2021_paper': target_paper, &#x27;july_2020_search_queries': july_2020_queries, &#x27;total_july_2020_papers': len(july_2020_papers_list), &#x27;related_papers_count': len(related_papers), &#x27;july_2020_papers': july_2020_papers_list, &#x27;related_papers': related_papers } july_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;july_2020_related_papers.json') "keyword">with open(july_results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(july_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nâœ“ July 2020 search results saved to: {july_results_file}') "keyword">if related_papers: print(f&#x27;\nðŸŽ¯ FOUND {len(related_papers)} RELATED JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS!') print(&#x27;These papers are candidates "keyword">for containing X-ray time profile diagrams.') "keyword">for paper "keyword">in related_papers: print(f&#x27;\nðŸ“„ {paper["title"]} ({paper["arxiv_id"]})') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper["published"]}') print(f&#x27; PDF: {paper["pdf_url"]}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\nâš  No July 2020 papers found "keyword">with overlapping authors') print(&#x27;Consider broader search criteria "keyword">or different time periods') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nâš  No July 2020 papers found by the same authors') print(&#x27;Consider expanding search criteria "keyword">or checking different date ranges') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nâš  No March 2021 papers found "keyword">in the data file') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\nâš  March 2021 papers file "keyword">not found: {march_papers_file}') print(f&#x27;\n=== SUMMARY ===') print(&#x27;âœ“ Analyzed March 2021 FRB paper by Nicastro et al.') print(&#x27;âœ“ Extracted author information "keyword">for related work search') print(&#x27;âœ“ Searched "keyword">for July 2020 papers by same authors') print(&#x27;âœ“ Ready "keyword">for detailed PDF analysis of promising papers') print(&#x27;\n*** ANALYSIS PHASE COMPLETE ***')
ðŸ“„ Output
Code Output: === ANALYZING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPER AND SEARCHING FOR JULY 2020 RELATED WORK === Objective: Analyze the found March 2021 paper and search for related July 2020 papers by same authors Focus: Look for X-ray time profile diagrams and establish author connections Using workspace directory: workspace_5f982798-16b9-4051-ab57-cfc7ebdb2a91 Workspace contents: - arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json (3,311 bytes) === INSPECTING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS DATA === March 2021 data structure: search_date: str = 2025-08-14T03:15:12.116876 total_papers_found: int = 618 unique_papers_count: int = 422 march_2021_papers_count: int = 1 search_queries_used: List with 14 items relevance_keywords: List with 15 items march_2021_papers: List with 1 items Found 1 March 2021 FRB papers === TARGET MARCH 2021 PAPER DETAILS === Title: Multiwavelength observations of Fast Radio Bursts arXiv ID: 2103.07786v2 Published: 2021-03-13T20:39:49Z Authors: Luciano Nicastro, Cristiano Guidorzi, Eliana Palazzi, Luca Zampieri, Massimo Turatto, Angela Gardini Categories: astro-ph.HE PDF URL: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2103.07786v2.pdf Relevance Score: 8 Has FRB terms: True Summary: The origin and phenomenology of the Fast Radio Burst (FRB) remains unknown despite more than a decade of efforts. Though several models have been proposed to explain the observed data, none is able to explain alone the variety of events so far recorded. The leading models consider magnetars as potential FRB sources. The recent detection of FRBs from the galactic magnetar SGR J1935+2154 seems to support them. Still, emission duration and energetic budget challenge all these models. Like for other... === AUTHOR ANALYSIS FOR JULY 2020 SEARCH === Total authors: 6 Author list: 1. Luciano Nicastro 2. Cristiano Guidorzi 3. Eliana Palazzi 4. Luca Zampieri 5. Massimo Turatto 6. "keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">import xml.etree.ElementTree "keyword">as ET "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time print(&#x27;=== COMPLETING JULY 2020 AUTHOR SEARCH FOR FRB PAPERS ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Search "keyword">for July 2020 papers by same authors "keyword">from March 2021 FRB paper') print(&#x27;Focus: Find papers that might contain X-ray time profile diagrams\n') # First, let's inspect the workspace structure workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace = workspace_dirs[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace}') "keyword">else: workspace = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;Created new workspace directory: {workspace}') print(f&#x27;\nWorkspace contents:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace): file_path = os.path.join(workspace, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Load the March 2021 FRB papers data march_papers_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(march_papers_file): print(f&#x27;\n=== LOADING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPER DATA ===') "keyword">with open(march_papers_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: march_data = json.load(f) march_papers = march_data.get(&#x27;march_2021_papers', []) "keyword">if march_papers: target_paper = march_papers[0] # The Nicastro et al. paper print(f&#x27;March 2021 paper: "{target_paper.get("title", "No title")}"') print(f&#x27;arXiv ID: {target_paper.get("arxiv_id", "No ID")}') # Extract author information authors = target_paper.get(&#x27;authors', []) print(f&#x27;Authors ({len(authors)}): {", ".join(authors)}') # Now perform a comprehensive search "keyword">for July 2020 papers by these authors print(f&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING ARXIV FOR JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS ===') # arXiv API base URL arxiv_base_url = &#x27;http://export.arxiv.org/api/query' # Create comprehensive search queries "keyword">for each author july_2020_queries = [] # Search by individual authors "keyword">with different name formats "keyword">for author "keyword">in authors: author_parts = author.split() "keyword">if len(author_parts) >= 2: # Full name "keyword">in quotes july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{author}"') # Last name, first initial format last_name = author_parts[-1] first_initial = author_parts[0][0] "keyword">if author_parts[0] "keyword">else &#x27;' july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{last_name}, {first_initial}"') # Just last name "keyword">for broader search july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{last_name}"') # Also search "keyword">for author combinations "keyword">with relevant terms primary_authors = authors[:3] # Focus on first 3 authors "keyword">for author "keyword">in primary_authors: july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{author}" AND (magnetar OR x-ray OR "soft gamma repeater" OR SGR)') july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{author}" AND (burst OR transient OR "time profile")') print(f&#x27;Created {len(july_2020_queries)} search queries "keyword">for author-based search') all_july_2020_papers = [] search_summary = [] "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(july_2020_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;\nSearch {i}/{len(july_2020_queries)}: "{query}"') params = { &#x27;search_query': query, &#x27;start': 0, &#x27;max_results': 50, # Increased "keyword">for comprehensive search &#x27;sortBy': 'submittedDate', &#x27;sortOrder': 'descending' } "keyword">try: response = requests.get(arxiv_base_url, params=params, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: root = ET.fromstring(response.text) namespaces = { &#x27;atom': 'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom', &#x27;arxiv': 'http://arxiv.org/schemas/atom' } entries = root.findall(&#x27;atom:entry', namespaces) print(f&#x27; Found {len(entries)} total papers') july_2020_count = 0 query_july_papers = [] "keyword">for entry "keyword">in entries: # Extract paper details title_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:title', namespaces) title = title_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if title_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No title' published_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:published', namespaces) published = published_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if published_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No date' # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is "keyword">from July 2020 "keyword">if published.startswith(&#x27;2020-07'): july_2020_count += 1 # Extract full paper details "keyword">for July 2020 papers summary_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:summary', namespaces) summary = summary_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if summary_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No summary' id_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:id', namespaces) arxiv_id = id_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if id_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No ID' "keyword">if &#x27;arxiv.org/abs/' "keyword">in arxiv_id: arxiv_id = arxiv_id.split(&#x27;/')[-1] # Get authors paper_authors = [] author_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:author', namespaces) "keyword">for author_elem "keyword">in author_elems: name_elem = author_elem.find(&#x27;atom:name', namespaces) "keyword">if name_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: paper_authors.append(name_elem.text.strip()) # Get categories categories = [] category_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:category', namespaces) "keyword">for cat_elem "keyword">in category_elems: term = cat_elem.get(&#x27;term') "keyword">if term: categories.append(term) july_paper = { &#x27;title': title, &#x27;authors': paper_authors, &#x27;summary': summary, &#x27;published': published, &#x27;arxiv_id': arxiv_id, &#x27;pdf_url': f'https://arxiv.org/pdf/{arxiv_id}.pdf', &#x27;categories': categories, &#x27;search_query': query, &#x27;found_via_author': query.split('"')[1] "keyword">if '"' "keyword">in query "keyword">else 'unknown' } query_july_papers.append(july_paper) all_july_2020_papers.append(july_paper) print(f&#x27; âœ“ July 2020: "{title[:50]}..." ({arxiv_id})') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper_authors[:2])}{"..." "keyword">if len(paper_authors) > 2 "keyword">else ""}') print(f&#x27; Published: {published}') print(f&#x27; July 2020 papers found: {july_2020_count}') search_summary.append({ &#x27;query': query, &#x27;total_papers': len(entries), &#x27;july_2020_papers': july_2020_count, &#x27;papers': query_july_papers }) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; Error: HTTP {response.status_code}') search_summary.append({ &#x27;query': query, &#x27;error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}', &#x27;total_papers': 0, &#x27;july_2020_papers': 0, &#x27;papers': [] }) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Exception: {str(e)}') search_summary.append({ &#x27;query': query, &#x27;error': str(e), &#x27;total_papers': 0, &#x27;july_2020_papers': 0, &#x27;papers': [] }) # Small delay between requests to be respectful to arXiv time.sleep(0.5) # Remove duplicates "keyword">and analyze July 2020 papers unique_july_2020_papers = {} "keyword">for paper "keyword">in all_july_2020_papers: arxiv_id = paper[&#x27;arxiv_id'] "keyword">if arxiv_id "keyword">not "keyword">in unique_july_2020_papers: unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id] = paper "keyword">else: # Keep track of multiple matching queries existing_queries = unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id].get(&#x27;matching_queries', [unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id]['search_query']]) new_queries = existing_queries + [paper[&#x27;search_query']] unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id][&#x27;matching_queries'] = list(set(new_queries)) july_2020_papers_list = list(unique_july_2020_papers.values()) print(f&#x27;\n=== JULY 2020 SEARCH RESULTS ANALYSIS ===') print(f&#x27;Total July 2020 papers found: {len(july_2020_papers_list)}') print(f&#x27;Unique July 2020 papers: {len(unique_july_2020_papers)}') "keyword">if july_2020_papers_list: print(f&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING JULY 2020 PAPERS FOR AUTHOR OVERLAP ===') # Check which papers have overlapping authors "keyword">with the March 2021 paper march_authors_lower = [author.lower() "keyword">for author "keyword">in authors] related_papers = [] potential_xray_papers = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(july_2020_papers_list, 1): paper_authors_lower = [author.lower() "keyword">for author "keyword">in paper.get(&#x27;authors', [])] # Check "keyword">for author overlap overlapping_authors = [] "keyword">for march_author "keyword">in march_authors_lower: "keyword">for paper_author "keyword">in paper_authors_lower: "keyword">if march_author "keyword">in paper_author "keyword">or paper_author "keyword">in march_author: overlapping_authors.append((march_author, paper_author)) author_overlap = len(overlapping_authors) > 0 print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Title: {paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper["published"]}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}') print(f&#x27; Found via: {paper.get("found_via_author", "unknown")}') "keyword">if author_overlap: print(f&#x27; *** AUTHOR OVERLAP DETECTED ***') print(f&#x27; Overlapping authors: {overlapping_authors[:3]}') related_papers.append(paper) # Check "keyword">for relevant content (X-ray, time profiles, etc.) title_lower = paper[&#x27;title'].lower() summary_lower = paper.get(&#x27;summary', '').lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title_lower} {summary_lower}' # Look "keyword">for key terms has_xray = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time_profile = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing', 'evolution']) has_magnetar = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;magnetar', 'sgr', 'soft gamma repeater']) has_burst = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;burst', 'flare', 'outburst']) has_multiwavelength = any(term "keyword">in combined_text "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;multiwavelength', 'multi-wavelength', 'simultaneous']) features = [] "keyword">if has_xray: features.append(&#x27;X-ray') "keyword">if has_time_profile: features.append(&#x27;Time Profile') "keyword">if has_magnetar: features.append(&#x27;Magnetar') "keyword">if has_burst: features.append(&#x27;Burst') "keyword">if has_multiwavelength: features.append(&#x27;Multiwavelength') "keyword">if features: print(f&#x27; *** KEY FEATURES: {", ".join(features)} ***') # Papers "keyword">with X-ray "keyword">and time profile are most promising "keyword">if has_xray "keyword">and has_time_profile: potential_xray_papers.append(paper) print(f&#x27; ðŸŽ¯ POTENTIAL X-RAY TIME PROFILE PAPER!') print(f&#x27; Summary: {paper.get("summary", "No summary")[:150]}...') # Save comprehensive July 2020 results july_results = { &#x27;search_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;march_2021_reference_paper': { &#x27;title': target_paper.get('title'), &#x27;arxiv_id': target_paper.get('arxiv_id'), &#x27;authors': target_paper.get('authors') }, &#x27;search_queries_used': july_2020_queries, &#x27;total_july_2020_papers_found': len(july_2020_papers_list), &#x27;unique_july_2020_papers': len(unique_july_2020_papers), &#x27;papers_with_author_overlap': len(related_papers), &#x27;potential_xray_time_profile_papers': len(potential_xray_papers), &#x27;july_2020_papers': july_2020_papers_list, &#x27;related_papers': related_papers, &#x27;potential_xray_papers': potential_xray_papers, &#x27;search_summary': search_summary } july_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;july_2020_comprehensive_search_results.json') "keyword">with open(july_results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(july_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nâœ“ Comprehensive July 2020 search results saved to: {july_results_file}') # Summary of findings print(f&#x27;\n=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH SUMMARY ===') print(f&#x27;ðŸ“Š Search Statistics:') print(f&#x27;
