Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed the **PLAN** requirements. The script successfully executed a comprehensive search for July 2020 papers by authors from the March 2021 FRB paper (Nicastro et al.). It loaded the existing March 2021 data, extracted the 6 authors, downloaded the March 2021 PDF (1.5MB), and conducted 24 targeted search queries using different author name formats and combinations. The search found 6 unique July 2020 papers by these authors, with detailed analysis of author overlap, content features (X-ray, time profiles, magnetar research), and potential relevance. Results were properly saved to 'july_2020_comprehensive_search_results.json' with complete metadata. The output shows several promising July 2020 papers including ones with X-ray content, magnetar research, and burst phenomena - exactly the type of papers that might contain X-ray time profile diagrams. **PLAN** alignment: 100% complete. The comprehensive search successfully identified potential July 2020 papers by the same authors that could contain the target X-ray time profile visualizations, establishing the foundation for finding the specific paper mentioned in the original plan.

"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">import xml.etree.ElementTree "keyword">as ET "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time print(&#x27;=== COMPLETING JULY 2020 AUTHOR SEARCH FOR FRB PAPERS ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Search "keyword">for July 2020 papers by same authors "keyword">from March 2021 FRB paper') print(&#x27;Focus: Find papers that might contain X-ray time profile diagrams\n') # First, let's inspect the workspace structure workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace = workspace_dirs[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace}') "keyword">else: workspace = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;Created new workspace directory: {workspace}') print(f&#x27;\nWorkspace contents:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace): file_path = os.path.join(workspace, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Load the March 2021 FRB papers data march_papers_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(march_papers_file): print(f&#x27;\n=== LOADING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPER DATA ===') "keyword">with open(march_papers_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: march_data = json.load(f) march_papers = march_data.get(&#x27;march_2021_papers', []) "keyword">if march_papers: target_paper = march_papers[0] # The Nicastro et al. paper print(f&#x27;March 2021 paper: "{target_paper.get("title", "No title")}"') print(f&#x27;arXiv ID: {target_paper.get("arxiv_id", "No ID")}') # Extract author information authors = target_paper.get(&#x27;authors', []) print(f&#x27;Authors ({len(authors)}): {", ".join(authors)}') # Now perform a comprehensive search "keyword">for July 2020 papers by these authors print(f&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING ARXIV FOR JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS ===') # arXiv API base URL arxiv_base_url = &#x27;http://export.arxiv.org/api/query' # Create comprehensive search queries "keyword">for each author july_2020_queries = [] # Search by individual authors "keyword">with different name formats "keyword">for author "keyword">in authors: author_parts = author.split() "keyword">if len(author_parts) >= 2: # Full name "keyword">in quotes july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{author}"') # Last name, first initial format last_name = author_parts[-1] first_initial = author_parts[0][0] "keyword">if author_parts[0] "keyword">else &#x27;' july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{last_name}, {first_initial}"') # Just last name "keyword">for broader search july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{last_name}"') # Also search "keyword">for author combinations "keyword">with relevant terms primary_authors = authors[:3] # Focus on first 3 authors "keyword">for author "keyword">in primary_authors: july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{author}" AND (magnetar OR x-ray OR "soft gamma repeater" OR SGR)') july_2020_queries.append(f&#x27;au:"{author}" AND (burst OR transient OR "time profile")') print(f&#x27;Created {len(july_2020_queries)} search queries "keyword">for author-based search') all_july_2020_papers = [] search_summary = [] "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(july_2020_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;\nSearch {i}/{len(july_2020_queries)}: "{query}"') params = { &#x27;search_query': query, &#x27;start': 0, &#x27;max_results': 50, # Increased "keyword">for comprehensive search &#x27;sortBy': 'submittedDate', &#x27;sortOrder': 'descending' } "keyword">try: response = requests.get(arxiv_base_url, params=params, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: root = ET.fromstring(response.text) namespaces = { &#x27;atom': 'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom', &#x27;arxiv': 'http://arxiv.org/schemas/atom' } entries = root.findall(&#x27;atom:entry', namespaces) print(f&#x27; Found {len(entries)} total papers') july_2020_count = 0 query_july_papers = [] "keyword">for entry "keyword">in entries: # Extract paper details title_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:title', namespaces) title = title_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if title_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No title' published_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:published', namespaces) published = published_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if published_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No date' # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is "keyword">from July 2020 "keyword">if published.startswith(&#x27;2020-07'): july_2020_count += 1 # Extract full paper details "keyword">for July 2020 papers summary_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:summary', namespaces) summary = summary_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if summary_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No summary' id_elem = entry.find(&#x27;atom:id', namespaces) arxiv_id = id_elem.text.strip() "keyword">if id_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">else &#x27;No ID' "keyword">if &#x27;arxiv.org/abs/' "keyword">in arxiv_id: arxiv_id = arxiv_id.split(&#x27;/')[-1] # Get authors paper_authors = [] author_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:author', namespaces) "keyword">for author_elem "keyword">in author_elems: name_elem = author_elem.find(&#x27;atom:name', namespaces) "keyword">if name_elem "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: paper_authors.append(name_elem.text.strip()) # Get categories categories = [] category_elems = entry.findall(&#x27;atom:category', namespaces) "keyword">for cat_elem "keyword">in category_elems: term = cat_elem.get(&#x27;term') "keyword">if term: categories.append(term) july_paper = { &#x27;title': title, &#x27;authors': paper_authors, &#x27;summary': summary, &#x27;published': published, &#x27;arxiv_id': arxiv_id, &#x27;pdf_url': f'https://arxiv.org/pdf/{arxiv_id}.pdf', &#x27;categories': categories, &#x27;search_query': query, &#x27;found_via_author': query.split('"')[1] "keyword">if '"' "keyword">in query "keyword">else 'unknown' } query_july_papers.append(july_paper) all_july_2020_papers.append(july_paper) print(f&#x27; âœ“ July 2020: "{title[:50]}..." ({arxiv_id})') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper_authors[:2])}{"..." "keyword">if len(paper_authors) > 2 "keyword">else ""}') print(f&#x27; Published: {published}') print(f&#x27; July 2020 papers found: {july_2020_count}') search_summary.append({ &#x27;query': query, &#x27;total_papers': len(entries), &#x27;july_2020_papers': july_2020_count, &#x27;papers': query_july_papers }) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; Error: HTTP {response.status_code}') search_summary.append({ &#x27;query': query, &#x27;error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}', &#x27;total_papers': 0, &#x27;july_2020_papers': 0, &#x27;papers': [] }) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Exception: {str(e)}') search_summary.append({ &#x27;query': query, &#x27;error': str(e), &#x27;total_papers': 0, &#x27;july_2020_papers': 0, &#x27;papers': [] }) # Small delay between requests to be respectful to arXiv time.sleep(0.5) # Remove duplicates "keyword">and analyze July 2020 papers unique_july_2020_papers = {} "keyword">for paper "keyword">in all_july_2020_papers: arxiv_id = paper[&#x27;arxiv_id'] "keyword">if arxiv_id "keyword">not "keyword">in unique_july_2020_papers: unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id] = paper "keyword">else: # Keep track of multiple matching queries existing_queries = unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id].get(&#x27;matching_queries', [unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id]['search_query']]) new_queries = existing_queries + [paper[&#x27;search_query']] unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id][&#x27;matching_queries'] = list(set(new_queries)) july_2020_papers_list = list(unique_july_2020_papers.values()) print(f&#x27;\n=== JULY 2020 SEARCH RESULTS ANALYSIS ===') print(f&#x27;Total July 2020 papers found: {len(july_2020_papers_list)}') print(f&#x27;Unique July 2020 papers: {len(unique_july_2020_papers)}') "keyword">if july_2020_papers_list: print(f&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING JULY 2020 PAPERS FOR AUTHOR OVERLAP ===') # Check which papers have overlapping authors "keyword">with the March 2021 paper march_authors_lower = [author.lower() "keyword">for author "keyword">in authors] related_papers = [] potential_xray_papers = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(july_2020_papers_list, 1): paper_authors_lower = [author.lower() "keyword">for author "keyword">in paper.get(&#x27;authors', [])] # Check "keyword">for author overlap overlapping_authors = [] "keyword">for march_author "keyword">in march_authors_lower: "keyword">for paper_author "keyword">in paper_authors_lower: "keyword">if march_author "keyword">in paper_author "keyword">or paper_author "keyword">in march_author: overlapping_authors.append((march_author, paper_author)) author_overlap = len(overlapping_authors) > 0 print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Title: {paper["title"]}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper["published"]}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}') print(f&#x27; "keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print(&#x27;=== ANALYZING JULY 2020 PAPERS FOR X-RAY TIME PROFILE DIAGRAMS ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Examine July 2020 papers by same authors to identify X-ray time profile content') print(&#x27;Focus: Find papers most likely to contain the target visualizations\n') # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace = workspace_dirs[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No workspace directory found') exit() print(f&#x27;\nWorkspace contents:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace): file_path = os.path.join(workspace, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Load the July 2020 search results july_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;july_2020_comprehensive_search_results.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(july_results_file): print(f&#x27;\n=== LOADING JULY 2020 SEARCH RESULTS ===') # First inspect the file structure "keyword">with open(july_results_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(500) print(&#x27;First 500 characters of July 2020 results:') print(sample_content) print(&#x27;...\n') # Load the full data "keyword">with open(july_results_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: july_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;July 2020 search results structure:') "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in july_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {value}') # Extract the July 2020 papers july_papers = july_data.get(&#x27;july_2020_papers', []) related_papers = july_data.get(&#x27;related_papers', []) potential_xray_papers = july_data.get(&#x27;potential_xray_papers', []) print(f&#x27;\n=== JULY 2020 PAPERS ANALYSIS ===') print(f&#x27;Total July 2020 papers found: {len(july_papers)}') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with author overlap: {len(related_papers)}') print(f&#x27;Potential X-ray papers: {len(potential_xray_papers)}') "keyword">if july_papers: print(f&#x27;\n=== DETAILED ANALYSIS OF ALL JULY 2020 PAPERS ===') # Analyze each paper "keyword">for X-ray time profile potential high_priority_papers = [] medium_priority_papers = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(july_papers, 1): print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Title: {paper.get("title", "No title")}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper.get("arxiv_id", "No ID")}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper.get("published", "No date")}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper.get("authors", []))}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}') print(f&#x27; PDF URL: {paper.get("pdf_url", "No URL")}') # Analyze title "keyword">and summary "keyword">for relevant content title = paper.get(&#x27;title', '').lower() summary = paper.get(&#x27;summary', '').lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title} {summary}' # Check "keyword">for key terms that indicate X-ray time profile content xray_terms = [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray', 'roentgen'] time_terms = [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing', 'evolution', 'variability', 'profile'] magnetar_terms = [&#x27;magnetar', 'sgr', 'soft gamma repeater', 'neutron star'] burst_terms = [&#x27;burst', 'flare', 'outburst', 'eruption', 'explosion'] observation_terms = [&#x27;observation', 'monitoring', 'survey', 'detection', 'analysis'] # Score the paper based on relevant terms xray_score = sum(1 "keyword">for term "keyword">in xray_terms "keyword">if term "keyword">in combined_text) time_score = sum(1 "keyword">for term "keyword">in time_terms "keyword">if term "keyword">in combined_text) magnetar_score = sum(1 "keyword">for term "keyword">in magnetar_terms "keyword">if term "keyword">in combined_text) burst_score = sum(1 "keyword">for term "keyword">in burst_terms "keyword">if term "keyword">in combined_text) observation_score = sum(1 "keyword">for term "keyword">in observation_terms "keyword">if term "keyword">in combined_text) total_score = xray_score + time_score + magnetar_score + burst_score + observation_score print(f&#x27; Relevance Scores:') print(f&#x27; X-ray terms: {xray_score}') print(f&#x27; Time/temporal terms: {time_score}') print(f&#x27; Magnetar terms: {magnetar_score}') print(f&#x27; Burst terms: {burst_score}') print(f&#x27; Observation terms: {observation_score}') print(f&#x27; Total relevance score: {total_score}') # Identify key features features = [] "keyword">if xray_score > 0: features.append(&#x27;X-ray') "keyword">if time_score > 0: features.append(&#x27;Temporal Analysis') "keyword">if magnetar_score > 0: features.append(&#x27;Magnetar') "keyword">if burst_score > 0: features.append(&#x27;Burst Phenomena') "keyword">if features: print(f&#x27; *** KEY FEATURES: {", ".join(features)} ***') # Prioritize papers based on X-ray + time profile combination "keyword">if xray_score > 0 "keyword">and time_score > 0: high_priority_papers.append({ &#x27;paper': paper, &#x27;xray_score': xray_score, &#x27;time_score': time_score, &#x27;total_score': total_score, &#x27;features': features }) print(f&#x27; ðŸŽ¯ HIGH PRIORITY: Contains both X-ray "keyword">and temporal terms!') "keyword">elif xray_score > 0 "keyword">or (magnetar_score > 0 "keyword">and burst_score > 0): medium_priority_papers.append({ &#x27;paper': paper, &#x27;xray_score': xray_score, &#x27;time_score': time_score, &#x27;total_score': total_score, &#x27;features': features }) print(f&#x27; â­ MEDIUM PRIORITY: Contains X-ray "keyword">or magnetar burst content') # Show summary preview summary_text = paper.get(&#x27;summary', 'No summary') print(f&#x27; Summary: {summary_text[:200]}...') # Rank "keyword">and display high priority papers "keyword">if high_priority_papers: print(f&#x27;\n=== HIGH PRIORITY PAPERS (X-ray + Temporal Analysis) ===') high_priority_papers.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;total_score'], reverse="keyword">True) "keyword">for i, item "keyword">in enumerate(high_priority_papers, 1): paper = item[&#x27;paper'] print(f&#x27;\nðŸ† RANK {i}: {paper.get("title", "No title")}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper.get("arxiv_id", "No ID")}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper.get("published", "No date")}') print(f&#x27; Total Score: {item["total_score"]} (X-ray: {item["xray_score"]}, Time: {item["time_score"]})') print(f&#x27; Features: {", ".join(item["features"])}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper.get("authors", [])[:3])}{"." "keyword">if len(paper.get("authors", [])) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') print(f&#x27; PDF: {paper.get("pdf_url", "No URL")}') # Show key excerpts "keyword">from title/summary title_lower = paper.get(&#x27;title', '').lower() summary_lower = paper.get(&#x27;summary', '').lower() # Find sentences containing both X-ray "keyword">and time-related terms "keyword">import re sentences = re.split(r&#x27;[.!?]+', summary_lower) relevant_sentences = [] "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: has_xray = any(term "keyword">in sentence "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time = any(term "keyword">in sentence "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time', 'temporal', 'profile', 'curve', 'evolution', 'variability']) "keyword">if has_xray "keyword">or has_time: relevant_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) "keyword">if relevant_sentences: print(f&#x27; Key excerpts:') "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in relevant_sentences[:2]: # Show top 2 relevant sentences print(f&#x27; - {sentence[:100]}...') # Display medium priority papers "keyword">if medium_priority_papers: print(f&#x27;\n=== MEDIUM PRIORITY PAPERS (X-ray "keyword">or Magnetar Content) ===') medium_priority_papers.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;total_score'], reverse="keyword">True) "keyword">for i, item "keyword">in enumerate(medium_priority_papers, 1): paper = item[&#x27;paper'] print(f&#x27;\nâ­ RANK {i}: {paper.get("title", "No title")}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper.get("arxiv_id", "No ID")}') print(f&#x27; Score: {item["total_score"]} | Features: {", ".join(item["features"])}') print(f&#x27; PDF: {paper.get("pdf_url", "No URL")}') # Save prioritized analysis prioritized_analysis = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;total_july_2020_papers': len(july_papers), &#x27;high_priority_papers_count': len(high_priority_papers), &#x27;medium_priority_papers_count': len(medium_priority_papers), &#x27;high_priority_papers': high_priority_papers, &#x27;medium_priority_papers': medium_priority_papers, &#x27;analysis_criteria': { &#x27;xray_terms': ['x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray', 'roentgen'], &#x27;time_terms': ['time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing', 'evolution', 'variability', 'profile'], &#x27;magnetar_terms': ['magnetar', 'sgr', 'soft gamma repeater', 'neutron star'], &#x27;burst_terms': ['burst', 'flare', 'outburst', 'eruption', 'explosion'] } } prioritized_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;july_2020_prioritized_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(prioritized_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(prioritized_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\nâœ“ Prioritized analysis saved to: {prioritized_file}') # Final recommendations print(f&#x27;\n=== FINAL RECOMMENDATIONS ===') "keyword">if high_priority_papers: top_paper = high_priority_papers[0][&#x27;paper'] print(f&#x27;ðŸŽ¯ TOP CANDIDATE FOR X-RAY TIME PROFILE DIAGRAMS:') print(f&#x27; Title: "{top_paper.get("title", "No title")}"') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {top_paper.get("arxiv_id", "No ID")}') print(f&#x27; Published: {top_paper.get("published", "No date")}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(top_paper.get("authors", []))}') print(f&#x27; PDF URL: {top_paper.get("pdf_url", "No URL")}') print(f&#x27;\n This paper has the highest likelihood of containing X-ray time profile diagrams') print(f&#x27; based on its content analysis "keyword">and author overlap "keyword">with the March 2021 FRB paper.') 2025-08-14 03:25:41

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed the **PLAN** requirements effectively. The script successfully analyzed the July 2020 papers found by the same authors from the March 2021 FRB paper, conducting detailed content analysis to identify papers most likely to contain X-ray time profile diagrams. It processed 8 July 2020 papers, applied relevance scoring based on X-ray terms, temporal analysis terms, magnetar content, and burst phenomena. The analysis identified 1 high-priority paper ('Spin-down rate of the transitional millisecond pulsar PSR J1023+0038') that contains both X-ray and temporal analysis terms, plus 2 medium-priority papers with X-ray content. The code saved comprehensive prioritized analysis to 'july_2020_prioritized_analysis.json' and provided clear recommendations for next steps including PDF analysis of the top candidate paper. **PLAN** alignment: 100% complete. The analysis successfully identified the most promising July 2020 paper by the same authors that has the highest likelihood of containing X-ray time profile diagrams, fulfilling the objective of finding papers with relevant visualizations from the specified timeframe and author connections.

ðŸ“ Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime print(&#x27;=== ANALYZING JULY 2020 PAPERS FOR X-RAY TIME PROFILE DIAGRAMS ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Examine July 2020 papers by same authors to identify X-ray time profile content') print(&#x27;Focus: Find papers most likely to contain the target visualizations\n') # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace = workspace_dirs[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No workspace directory found') exit() print(f&#x27;\nWorkspace contents:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace): file_path = os.path.join(workspace, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Load the July 2020 search results july_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, &#x27;july_2020_comprehensive_search_results.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(july_results_file): print(f&#x27;\n=== LOADING JULY 2020 SEARCH RESULTS ===') # First inspect the file structure "keyword">with open(july_results_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(500) print(&#x27;First 500 characters of July 2020 results:') print(sample_content) print(&#x27;...\n') # Load the full data "keyword">with open(july_results_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: july_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;July 2020 search results structure:') "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in july_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {value}') # Extract the July 2020 papers july_papers = july_data.get(&#x27;july_2020_papers', []) related_papers = july_data.get(&#x27;related_papers', []) potential_xray_papers = july_data.get(&#x27;potential_xray_papers', []) print(f&#x27;\n=== JULY 2020 PAPERS ANALYSIS ===') print(f&#x27;Total July 2020 papers found: {len(july_papers)}') print(f&#x27;Papers "keyword">with author overlap: {len(related_papers)}') print(f&#x27;Potential X-ray papers: {len(potential_xray_papers)}') "keyword">if july_papers: print(f&#x27;\n=== DETAILED ANALYSIS OF ALL JULY 2020 PAPERS ===') # Analyze each paper "keyword">for X-ray time profile potential high_priority_papers = [] medium_priority_papers = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(july_papers, 1): print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Title: {paper.get("title", "No title")}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper.get("arxiv_id", "No ID")}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper.get("published", "No date")}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper.get("authors", []))}') print(f&#x27; Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}') print(f&#x27; PDF URL: {paper.get("pdf_url", "No URL")}') # Analyze title "keyword">and summary "keyword">for relevant content title = paper.get(&#x27;title', '').lower() summary = paper.get(&#x27;summary', '').lower() combined_text = f&#x27;{title} {summary}' # Check "keyword">for key terms that indicate X-ray time profile content xray_terms = [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray', 'roentgen'] time_terms = [&#x27;time profile', 'light curve', 'temporal', 'timing', 'evolution', 'variability', 'profile'] magnetar_terms = [&#x27;magnetar', 'sgr', 'soft gamma repeater', 'neutron star'] burst_terms = [&#x27;burst', 'flare', 'outburst', 'eruption', 'explosion'] observation_terms = [&#x27;observation', 'monitoring', 'survey', 'detection', 'analysis'] # Score the paper based on relevant terms xray_score = sum(1 "keyword">for term "keyword">in xray_terms "keyword">if term "keyword">in combined_text) time_score = sum(1 "keyword">for term "keyword">in time_terms "keyword">if term "keyword">in combined_text) magnetar_score = sum(1 "keyword">for term "keyword">in magnetar_terms "keyword">if term "keyword">in combined_text) burst_score = sum(1 "keyword">for term "keyword">in burst_terms "keyword">if term "keyword">in combined_text) observation_score = sum(1 "keyword">for term "keyword">in observation_terms "keyword">if term "keyword">in combined_text) total_score = xray_score + time_score + magnetar_score + burst_score + observation_score print(f&#x27; Relevance Scores:') print(f&#x27; X-ray terms: {xray_score}') print(f&#x27; Time/temporal terms: {time_score}') print(f&#x27; Magnetar terms: {magnetar_score}') print(f&#x27; Burst terms: {burst_score}') print(f&#x27; Observation terms: {observation_score}') print(f&#x27; Total relevance score: {total_score}') # Identify key features features = [] "keyword">if xray_score > 0: features.append(&#x27;X-ray') "keyword">if time_score > 0: features.append(&#x27;Temporal Analysis') "keyword">if magnetar_score > 0: features.append(&#x27;Magnetar') "keyword">if burst_score > 0: features.append(&#x27;Burst Phenomena') "keyword">if features: print(f&#x27; *** KEY FEATURES: {", ".join(features)} ***') # Prioritize papers based on X-ray + time profile combination "keyword">if xray_score > 0 "keyword">and time_score > 0: high_priority_papers.append({ &#x27;paper': paper, &#x27;xray_score': xray_score, &#x27;time_score': time_score, &#x27;total_score': total_score, &#x27;features': features }) print(f&#x27; ðŸŽ¯ HIGH PRIORITY: Contains both X-ray "keyword">and temporal terms!') "keyword">elif xray_score > 0 "keyword">or (magnetar_score > 0 "keyword">and burst_score > 0): medium_priority_papers.append({ &#x27;paper': paper, &#x27;xray_score': xray_score, &#x27;time_score': time_score, &#x27;total_score': total_score, &#x27;features': features }) print(f&#x27; â­ MEDIUM PRIORITY: Contains X-ray "keyword">or magnetar burst content') # Show summary preview summary_text = paper.get(&#x27;summary', 'No summary') print(f&#x27; Summary: {summary_text[:200]}...') # Rank "keyword">and display high priority papers "keyword">if high_priority_papers: print(f&#x27;\n=== HIGH PRIORITY PAPERS (X-ray + Temporal Analysis) ===') high_priority_papers.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;total_score'], reverse="keyword">True) "keyword">for i, item "keyword">in enumerate(high_priority_papers, 1): paper = item[&#x27;paper'] print(f&#x27;\nðŸ† RANK {i}: {paper.get("title", "No title")}') print(f&#x27; arXiv ID: {paper.get("arxiv_id", "No ID")}') print(f&#x27; Published: {paper.get("published", "No date")}') print(f&#x27; Total Score: {item["total_score"]} (X-ray: {item["xray_score"]}, Time: {item["time_score"]})') print(f&#x27; Features: {", ".join(item["features"])}') print(f&#x27; Authors: {", ".join(paper.get("authors", [])[:3])}{"." "keyword">if len(paper.get("authors", [])) > 3 "keyword">else ""}') print(f&#x27; PDF: {paper.get("pdf_url", "No URL")}') # Show key excerpts "keyword">from title/summary title_lower = paper.get(&#x27;title', '').lower() summary_lower = paper.get(&#x27;summary', '').lower() # Find sentences containing both X-ray "keyword">and time-related terms "keyword">import re sentences = re.split(r&#x27;[.!?]+', summary_lower) relevant_sentences = [] "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: has_xray = any(term "keyword">in sentence "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;x-ray', 'xray', 'x ray']) has_time = any(term "keyword">in sentence "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;time', 'temporal', 'profile', 'curve', 'evolution', 'variability']) "keyword">if has_xray "keyword">or has_time: relevant_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) "keyword">if relevant_sentences: print(f&#x27; 2025-08-14 03:26:13

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport requests\nimport xml.etree.ElementTree as ET\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport time\nimport re\n\nprint(\'=== SEARCHING ARXIV FOR MULTIWAVELENGTH FRB PAPERS FROM MARCH 2021 ===\')\nprint(\'Objective: Find papers on multiwavelength observations of fast radio bursts from March 2021\')\nprint(\'Focus: Papers with X-ray time profile diagrams or similar visualizations\\n\')\n\n# Ensure workspace exists\nworkspace = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok=True)\n\n# arXiv API base URL\narxiv_base_url = \'http://export.arxiv.org/api/query\'\n\n# Comprehensive search queries for FRB multiwavelength observations\nsearch_queries = [\n \'fast radio burst AND multiwavelength\',\n \'FRB AND X-ray\',\n \'fast radio burst AND X-ray\',\n \'FRB AND multiwavelength\',\n \'fast radio burst AND time profile\',\n \'FRB AND time profile\',\n \'fast radio burst AND observation\',\n \'FRB 180916 OR FRB 121102 OR FRB 200428\', # Known repeating FRBs\n \'magnetar AND fast radio burst\',\n \'SGR AND fast radio burst\',\n \'fast radio burst AND simultaneous\',\n \'FRB AND simultaneous\',\n \'fast radio burst AND counterpart\',\n \'FRB AND counterpart\'\n]\n\nprint(f\'Using {len(search_queries)} targeted search queries for FRB research\\n\')\n\nall_papers = []\nsearch_results = {}\n\nfor i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1):\n print(f\'Search {i}/{len(search_queries)}: "{query}"\')\n \n # Search parameters for arXiv API\n params = {\n \'search_query\': f\'all:{query}\',\n \'start\': 0,\n \'max_results\': 50, # Reasonable limit per query\n \'sortBy\': \'submittedDate\',\n \'sortOrder\': \'descending\'\n }\n \n try:\n response = requests.get(arxiv_base_url, params=params, timeout=30)\n print(f\'Status code: {response.status_code}\')\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n # Parse XML response\n try:\n root = ET.fromstring(response.text)\n \n # Define XML namespaces\n namespaces = {\n \'atom\': \'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom\',\n \'arxiv\': \'http://arxiv.org/schemas/atom\'\n }\n \n entries = root.findall(\'atom:entry\', namespaces)\n print(f\'Found {len(entries)} papers for query "{query}"\')\n \n query_papers = []\n \n for entry in entries:\n # Extract paper details\n title_elem = entry.find(\'atom:title\', namespaces)\n title = title_elem.text.strip() if title_elem is not None else \'No title\'\n \n summary_elem = entry.find(\'atom:summary\', namespaces)\n summary = summary_elem.text.strip() if summary_elem is not None else \'No summary\'\n \n published_elem = entry.find(\'atom:published\', namespaces)\n published = published_elem.text.strip() if published_elem is not None else \'No date\'\n \n # Get arXiv ID and PDF link\n id_elem = entry.find(\'atom:id\', namespaces)\n arxiv_id = id_elem.text.strip() if id_elem is not None else \'No ID\'\n \n # Extract arXiv ID from URL\n if \'arxiv.org/abs/\' in arxiv_id:\n arxiv_id = arxiv_id.split(\'/\')[-1]\n \n # Construct PDF URL\n pdf_url = f\'https://arxiv.org/pdf/{arxiv_id}.pdf\'\n \n # Get authors\n authors = []\n author_elems = entry.findall(\'atom:author\', namespaces)\n for author_elem in author_elems:\n name_elem = author_elem.find(\'atom:name\', namespaces)\n if name_elem is not None:\n authors.append(name_elem.text.strip())\n \n # Get categories\n categories = []\n category_elems = entry.findall(\'atom:category\', namespaces)\n for cat_elem in category_elems:\n term = cat_elem.get(\'term\')\n if term:\n categories.append(term)\n \n paper_info = {\n \'title\': title,\n \'authors\': authors,\n \'summary\': summary,\n \'published\': published,\n \'arxiv_id\': arxiv_id,\n \'pdf_url\': pdf_url,\n \'categories\': categories,\n \'search_query\': query\n }\n \n query_papers.append(paper_info)\n all_papers.append(paper_info)\n \n search_results[query] = query_papers\n print(f\'âœ“ Extracted {len(query_papers)} papers from XML\')\n \n except ET.ParseError as e:\n print(f\'Error parsing XML for query "{query}": {str(e)}\')\n continue\n \n else:\n print(f\'Failed to search arXiv: {response.status_code}\')\n continue\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\'Error searching for "{query}": {str(e)}\')\n continue\n \n # Small delay between requests to be respectful to arXiv\n time.sleep(0.5)\n print()\n\nprint(f\'=== FILTERING PAPERS BY MARCH 2021 AND RELEVANCE ===\')\nprint(f\'Total papers found across all queries: {len(all_papers)}\')\n\n# Remove duplicates based on arXiv ID\nunique_papers = {}\nfor paper in all_papers:\n arxiv_id = paper[\'arxiv_id\']\n if arxiv_id not in unique_papers:\n unique_papers[arxiv_id] = paper\n else:\n # Keep track of multiple matching queries\n existing_queries = unique_papers[arxiv_id].get(\'matching_queries\', [unique_papers[arxiv_id][\'search_query\']])\n new_queries = existing_queries + [paper[\'search_query\']]\n unique_papers[arxiv_id][\'matching_queries\'] = list(set(new_queries))\n\nprint(f\'Unique papers after deduplication: {len(unique_papers)}\')\n\n# Filter papers by March 2021 submission date and relevance\nmarch_2021_papers = []\nrelevant_keywords = [\n \'multiwavelength\', \'multi-wavelength\', \'x-ray\', \'time profile\', \'light curve\',\n \'simultaneous\', \'counterpart\', \'observation\', \'detection\', \'magnetar\',\n \'sgr\', \'soft gamma repeater\', \'burst\', \'emission\', \'spectrum\'\n]\n\nfor paper in unique_papers.values():\n published_date = paper[\'published\']\n \n # Parse the date (arXiv format: 2021-03-15T17:59:59Z)\n try:\n if published_date and published_date != \'No date\':\n # Extract year and month from date string\n if published_date.startswith(\'2021-03\'):\n # Check if the paper is actually about FRB multiwavelength observations\n title_lower = paper[\'title\'].lower()\n summary_lower = paper[\'summary\'].lower()\n combined_text = f\'{title_lower} {summary_lower}\'\n \n # Count relevant keywords\n relevance_score = sum(1 for keyword in relevant_keywords if keyword in combined_text)\n \n # Check for FRB terms\n frb_terms = [\'fast radio burst\', \'frb\', \'radio burst\']\n has_frb_terms = any(term in combined_text for term in frb_terms)\n \n paper[\'relevance_score\'] = relevance_score\n paper[\'has_frb_terms\'] = has_frb_terms\n \n # Include if it has FRB terms and some relevance\n if has_frb_terms or relevance_score > 1:\n march_2021_papers.append(paper)\n print(f\'âœ“ March 2021 FRB paper found: "{paper["title"][:80]}..."\')\n print(f\' Published: {published_date}\')\n print(f\' arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}\')\n print(f\' Has FRB terms: {has_frb_terms}\')\n print(f\' Relevance score: {relevance_score}\')\n print(f\' Categories: {paper.get("categories", [])[:3]}\')\n print(f\' Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"][:3])}{"..." if len(paper["authors"]) > 3 else ""}\')\n \n # Check for X-ray and time profile keywords specifically\n has_xray = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'x-ray\', \'xray\', \'x ray\'])\n has_time_profile = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'time profile\', \'light curve\', \'temporal\', \'timing\'])\n \n if has_xray:\n print(f\' *** CONTAINS X-RAY TERMS ***\')\n if has_time_profile:\n print(f\' *** CONTAINS TIME PROFILE TERMS ***\')\n \n print()\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\'Error parsing date for paper: {str(e)}\')\n continue\n\nprint(f\'\\n=== MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS SUMMARY ===\')\nprint(f\'Relevant FRB papers from March 2021: {len(march_2021_papers)}\')\n\nif march_2021_papers:\n # Sort by relevance score\n march_2021_papers.sort(key=lambda x: x.get(\'relevance_score\', 0), reverse=True)\n \n # Save March 2021 papers for detailed analysis\n march_papers_file = os.path.join(workspace, \'arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json\')\n with open(march_papers_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump({\n \'search_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'total_papers_found\': len(all_papers),\n \'unique_papers_count\': len(unique_papers),\n \'march_2021_papers_count\': len(march_2021_papers),\n \'search_queries_used\': search_queries,\n \'relevance_keywords\': relevant_keywords,\n \'march_2021_papers\': march_2021_papers\n }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n \n print(f\'âœ“ March 2021 FRB papers saved to: {march_papers_file}\')\n \n # Display detailed summary of March 2021 papers\n print(f\'\\n=== MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS DETAILED ANALYSIS ===\')\n \n papers_with_xray = []\n papers_with_time_profile = []\n papers_with_multiwavelength = []\n \n for i, paper in enumerate(march_2021_papers, 1):\n print(f\'\\n{i}. Title: {paper["title"]}\')\n print(f\' arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}\')\n print(f\' Published: {paper["published"]}\')\n print(f\' Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}\')\n print(f\' Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}\')\n print(f\' PDF: {paper["pdf_url"]}\')\n print(f\' Relevance Score: {paper.get("relevance_score", 0)}\')\n \n # Analyze content for specific terms\n title_lower = paper[\'title\'].lower()\n summary_lower = paper[\'summary\'].lower()\n combined_text = f\'{title_lower} {summary_lower}\'\n \n # Check for key terms\n has_xray = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'x-ray\', \'xray\', \'x ray\'])\n has_time_profile = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'time profile\', \'light curve\', \'temporal\', \'timing\'])\n has_multiwavelength = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'multiwavelength\', \'multi-wavelength\', \'simultaneous\'])\n \n key_features = []\n if has_xray:\n key_features.append(\'X-ray\')\n papers_with_xray.append(paper)\n if has_time_profile:\n key_features.append(\'Time Profile\')\n papers_with_time_profile.append(paper)\n if has_multiwavelength:\n key_features.append(\'Multiwavelength\')\n papers_with_multiwavelength.append(paper)\n \n if key_features:\n print(f\' *** KEY FEATURES: {\', \'.join(key_features)} ***\')\n \n print(f\' Summary preview: {paper["summary"][:300]}...\')\n \n # Show matching search queries if available\n if \'matching_queries\' in paper:\n print(f\' Matched queries: {", ".join(paper["matching_queries"][:3])}{"..." if len(paper.get("matching_queries", [])) > 3 else ""}\')\n \n # Summary of papers with key features\n print(f\'\\n=== FEATURE ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\')\n print(f\'Papers with X-ray content: {len(papers_with_xray)}\')\n print(f\'Papers with time profile content: {len(papers_with_time_profile)}\')\n print(f\'Papers with multiwavelength content: {len(papers_with_multiwavelength)}\')\n \n # Identify the most promising papers for X-ray time profile diagrams\n promising_papers = []\n for paper in march_2021_papers:\n title_lower = paper[\'title\'].lower()\n summary_lower = paper[\'summary\'].lower()\n combined_text = f\'{title_lower} {summary_lower}\'\n \n has_xray = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'x-ray\', \'xray\', \'x ray\'])\n has_time_profile = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'time profile\', \'light curve\', \'temporal\', \'timing\'])\n \n if has_xray and has_time_profile:\n promising_papers.append(paper)\n \n if promising_papers:\n print(f\'\\nðŸŽ¯ MOST PROMISING PAPERS (X-ray + Time Profile): {len(promising_papers)}\')\n for paper in promising_papers:\n print(f\' - {paper["title"]} ({paper["arxiv_id"]})\')\n print(f\' Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"][:3])}{"..." if len(paper["authors"]) > 3 else ""}\')\n \n print(f\'\\n=== NEXT STEPS ===\')\n print(f\'âœ“ Found {len(march_2021_papers)} relevant FRB papers from March 2021\')\n print(f\'âœ“ Identified {len(papers_with_xray)} papers with X-ray content\')\n print(f\'âœ“ Identified {len(papers_with_time_profile)} papers with time profile content\')\n print(f\'âœ“ Ready to analyze paper content for X-ray time profile diagrams\')\n print(f\'âœ“ Author information extracted for finding related July 2020 papers\')\n \nelse:\n print(\'\\nâš  No relevant FRB papers found from March 2021\')\n print(\'Saving all search results for further analysis\')\n \n # Save all search results for analysis\n all_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, \'arxiv_frb_search_results.json\')\n with open(all_results_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump({\n \'search_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'total_papers_found\': len(all_papers),\n \'unique_papers_count\': len(unique_papers),\n \'search_queries_used\': search_queries,\n \'sample_papers\': list(unique_papers.values())[:10] # Save first 10 for inspection\n }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n \n print(f\'All search results saved to: {all_results_file}\')\n print(\'Consider expanding date range or refining search terms\')\n\nprint(\'\\n*** ARXIV FRB SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ***\')',
"description": "This implementation searches arXiv for papers about multiwavelength observations of fast radio bursts published in March 2021. The approach uses comprehensive search queries targeting FRB research with keywords like 'fast radio burst', 'multiwavelength', 'X-ray', and 'time profile'. The code filters results by publication date (March 2021) and analyzes content relevance using keyword scoring. It extracts detailed paper information including titles, authors, abstracts, and arXiv IDs, then identifies papers most likely to contain X-ray time profile diagrams by checking for both X-ray and temporal analysis terms. The results are saved to workspace files for further analysis, establishing the foundation for finding related July 2020 papers by the same authors. The code includes comprehensive error handling, progress reporting, and detailed analysis of paper features to identify the most promising candidates for containing the target visualizations.",
}

"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport requests\nimport xml.etree.ElementTree as ET\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport time\nimport re\n\nprint(\'=== SEARCHING ARXIV FOR MULTIWAVELENGTH FRB PAPERS FROM MARCH 2021 ===\')\nprint(\'Objective: Find papers on multiwavelength observations of fast radio bursts from March 2021\')\nprint(\'Focus: Papers with X-ray time profile diagrams or similar visualizations\\n\')\n\n# Ensure workspace exists\nworkspace = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok=True)\n\n# arXiv API base URL\narxiv_base_url = \'http://export.arxiv.org/api/query\'\n\n# Comprehensive search queries for FRB multiwavelength observations\nsearch_queries = [\n \'fast radio burst AND multiwavelength\',\n \'FRB AND X-ray\',\n \'fast radio burst AND X-ray\',\n \'FRB AND multiwavelength\',\n \'fast radio burst AND time profile\',\n \'FRB AND time profile\',\n \'fast radio burst AND observation\',\n \'FRB 180916 OR FRB 121102 OR FRB 200428\', # Known repeating FRBs\n \'magnetar AND fast radio burst\',\n \'SGR AND fast radio burst\',\n \'fast radio burst AND simultaneous\',\n \'FRB AND simultaneous\',\n \'fast radio burst AND counterpart\',\n \'FRB AND counterpart\'\n]\n\nprint(f\'Using {len(search_queries)} targeted search queries for FRB research\\n\')\n\nall_papers = []\nsearch_results = {}\n\nfor i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1):\n print(f\'Search {i}/{len(search_queries)}: "{query}"\')\n \n # Search parameters for arXiv API\n params = {\n \'search_query\': f\'all:{query}\',\n \'start\': 0,\n \'max_results\': 50, # Reasonable limit per query\n \'sortBy\': \'submittedDate\',\n \'sortOrder\': \'descending\'\n }\n \n try:\n response = requests.get(arxiv_base_url, params=params, timeout=30)\n print(f\'Status code: {response.status_code}\')\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n # Parse XML response\n try:\n root = ET.fromstring(response.text)\n \n # Define XML namespaces\n namespaces = {\n \'atom\': \'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom\',\n \'arxiv\': \'http://arxiv.org/schemas/atom\'\n }\n \n entries = root.findall(\'atom:entry\', namespaces)\n print(f\'Found {len(entries)} papers for query "{query}"\')\n \n query_papers = []\n \n for entry in entries:\n # Extract paper details\n title_elem = entry.find(\'atom:title\', namespaces)\n title = title_elem.text.strip() if title_elem is not None else \'No title\'\n \n summary_elem = entry.find(\'atom:summary\', namespaces)\n summary = summary_elem.text.strip() if summary_elem is not None else \'No summary\'\n \n published_elem = entry.find(\'atom:published\', namespaces)\n published = published_elem.text.strip() if published_elem is not None else \'No date\'\n \n # Get arXiv ID and PDF link\n id_elem = entry.find(\'atom:id\', namespaces)\n arxiv_id = id_elem.text.strip() if id_elem is not None else \'No ID\'\n \n # Extract arXiv ID from URL\n if \'arxiv.org/abs/\' in arxiv_id:\n arxiv_id = arxiv_id.split(\'/\')[-1]\n \n # Construct PDF URL\n pdf_url = f\'https://arxiv.org/pdf/{arxiv_id}.pdf\'\n \n # Get authors\n authors = []\n author_elems = entry.findall(\'atom:author\', namespaces)\n for author_elem in author_elems:\n name_elem = author_elem.find(\'atom:name\', namespaces)\n if name_elem is not None:\n authors.append(name_elem.text.strip())\n \n # Get categories\n categories = []\n category_elems = entry.findall(\'atom:category\', namespaces)\n for cat_elem in category_elems:\n term = cat_elem.get(\'term\')\n if term:\n categories.append(term)\n \n paper_info = {\n \'title\': title,\n \'authors\': authors,\n \'summary\': summary,\n \'published\': published,\n \'arxiv_id\': arxiv_id,\n \'pdf_url\': pdf_url,\n \'categories\': categories,\n \'search_query\': query\n }\n \n query_papers.append(paper_info)\n all_papers.append(paper_info)\n \n search_results[query] = query_papers\n print(f\'âœ“ Extracted {len(query_papers)} papers from XML\')\n \n except ET.ParseError as e:\n print(f\'Error parsing XML for query "{query}": {str(e)}\')\n continue\n \n else:\n print(f\'Failed to search arXiv: {response.status_code}\')\n continue\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\'Error searching for "{query}": {str(e)}\')\n continue\n \n # Small delay between requests to be respectful to arXiv\n time.sleep(0.5)\n print()\n\nprint(f\'=== FILTERING PAPERS BY MARCH 2021 AND RELEVANCE ===\')\nprint(f\'Total papers found across all queries: {len(all_papers)}\')\n\n# Remove duplicates based on arXiv ID\nunique_papers = {}\nfor paper in all_papers:\n arxiv_id = paper[\'arxiv_id\']\n if arxiv_id not in unique_papers:\n unique_papers[arxiv_id] = paper\n else:\n # Keep track of multiple matching queries\n existing_queries = unique_papers[arxiv_id].get(\'matching_queries\', [unique_papers[arxiv_id][\'search_query\']])\n new_queries = existing_queries + [paper[\'search_query\']]\n unique_papers[arxiv_id][\'matching_queries\'] = list(set(new_queries))\n\nprint(f\'Unique papers after deduplication: {len(unique_papers)}\')\n\n# Filter papers by March 2021 submission date and relevance\nmarch_2021_papers = []\nrelevant_keywords = [\n \'multiwavelength\', \'multi-wavelength\', \'x-ray\', \'time profile\', \'light curve\',\n \'simultaneous\', \'counterpart\', \'observation\', \'detection\', \'magnetar\',\n \'sgr\', \'soft gamma repeater\', \'burst\', \'emission\', \'spectrum\'\n]\n\nfor paper in unique_papers.values():\n published_date = paper[\'published\']\n \n # Parse the date (arXiv format: 2021-03-15T17:59:59Z)\n try:\n if published_date and published_date != \'No date\':\n # Extract year and month from date string\n if published_date.startswith(\'2021-03\'):\n # Check if the paper is actually about FRB multiwavelength observations\n title_lower = paper[\'title\'].lower()\n summary_lower = paper[\'summary\'].lower()\n combined_text = f\'{title_lower} {summary_lower}\'\n \n # Count relevant keywords\n relevance_score = sum(1 for keyword in relevant_keywords if keyword in combined_text)\n \n # Check for FRB terms\n frb_terms = [\'fast radio burst\', \'frb\', \'radio burst\']\n has_frb_terms = any(term in combined_text for term in frb_terms)\n \n paper[\'relevance_score\'] = relevance_score\n paper[\'has_frb_terms\'] = has_frb_terms\n \n # Include if it has FRB terms and some relevance\n if has_frb_terms or relevance_score > 1:\n march_2021_papers.append(paper)\n print(f\'âœ“ March 2021 FRB paper found: "{paper["title"][:80]}..."\')\n print(f\' Published: {published_date}\')\n print(f\' arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}\')\n print(f\' Has FRB terms: {has_frb_terms}\')\n print(f\' Relevance score: {relevance_score}\')\n print(f\' Categories: {paper.get("categories", [])[:3]}\')\n print(f\' Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"][:3])}{"." if len(paper["authors"]) > 3 else ""}\')\n \n # Check for X-ray and time profile keywords specifically\n has_xray = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'x-ray\', \'xray\', \'x ray\'])\n has_time_profile = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'time profile\', \'light curve\', \'temporal\', \'timing\'])\n \n if has_xray:\n print(f\' *** CONTAINS X-RAY TERMS ***\')\n if has_time_profile:\n print(f\' *** CONTAINS TIME PROFILE TERMS ***\')\n \n print()\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\'Error parsing date for paper: {str(e)}\')\n continue\n\nprint(f\'\\n=== MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS SUMMARY ===\')\nprint(f\'Relevant FRB papers from March 2021: {len(march_2021_papers)}\')\n\nif march_2021_papers:\n # Sort by relevance score\n march_2021_papers.sort(key=lambda x: x.get(\'relevance_score\', 0), reverse=True)\n \n # Save March 2021 papers for detailed analysis\n march_papers_file = os.path.join(workspace, \'arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json\')\n with open(march_papers_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump({\n \'search_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'total_papers_found\': len(all_papers),\n \'unique_papers_count\': len(unique_papers),\n \'march_2021_papers_count\': len(march_2021_papers),\n \'search_queries_used\': search_queries,\n \'relevance_keywords\': relevant_keywords,\n \'march_2021_papers\': march_2021_papers\n }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n \n print(f\'âœ“ March 2021 FRB papers saved to: {march_papers_file}\')\n \n # Display detailed summary of March 2021 papers\n print(f\'\\n=== MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS DETAILED ANALYSIS ===\')\n \n papers_with_xray = []\n papers_with_time_profile = []\n papers_with_multiwavelength = []\n \n for i, paper in enumerate(march_2021_papers, 1):\n print(f\'\\n{i}. Title: {paper["title"]}\')\n print(f\' arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}\')\n print(f\' Published: {paper["published"]}\')\n print(f\' Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}\')\n print(f\' Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}\')\n print(f\' PDF: {paper["pdf_url"]}\')\n print(f\' Relevance Score: {paper.get("relevance_score", 0)}\')\n \n # Analyze content for specific terms\n title_lower = paper[\'title\'].lower()\n summary_lower = paper[\'summary\'].lower()\n combined_text = f\'{title_lower} {summary_lower}\'\n \n # Check for key terms\n has_xray = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'x-ray\', \'xray\', \'x ray\'])\n has_time_profile = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'time profile\', \'light curve\', \'temporal\', \'timing\'])\n has_multiwavelength = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'multiwavelength\', \'multi-wavelength\', \'simultaneous\'])\n \n key_features = []\n if has_xray:\n key_features.append(\'X-ray\')\n papers_with_xray.append(paper)\n if has_time_profile:\n key_features.append(\'Time Profile\')\n papers_with_time_profile.append(paper)\n if has_multiwavelength:\n key_features.append(\'Multiwavelength\')\n papers_with_multiwavelength.append(paper)\n \n if key_features:\n print(f\' *** KEY FEATURES: {", ".join(key_features)} ***\')\n \n print(f\' Summary preview: {paper["summary"][:300]}...\')\n \n # Show matching search queries if available\n if \'matching_queries\' in paper:\n print(f\' Matched queries: {", ".join(paper["matching_queries"][:3])}{"." if len(paper.get("matching_queries", [])) > 3 else ""}\')\n \n # Summary of papers with key features\n print(f\'\\n=== FEATURE ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\')\n print(f\'Papers with X-ray content: {len(papers_with_xray)}\')\n print(f\'Papers with time profile content: {len(papers_with_time_profile)}\')\n print(f\'Papers with multiwavelength content: {len(papers_with_multiwavelength)}\')\n \n # Identify the most promising papers for X-ray time profile diagrams\n promising_papers = []\n for paper in march_2021_papers:\n title_lower = paper[\'title\'].lower()\n summary_lower = paper[\'summary\'].lower()\n combined_text = f\'{title_lower} {summary_lower}\'\n \n has_xray = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'x-ray\', \'xray\', \'x ray\'])\n has_time_profile = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'time profile\', \'light curve\', \'temporal\', \'timing\'])\n \n if has_xray and has_time_profile:\n promising_papers.append(paper)\n \n if promising_papers:\n print(f\'\\nðŸŽ¯ MOST PROMISING PAPERS (X-ray + Time Profile): {len(promising_papers)}\')\n for paper in promising_papers:\n print(f\' - {paper["title"]} ({paper["arxiv_id"]})\')\n print(f\' Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"][:3])}{"." if len(paper["authors"]) > 3 else ""}\')\n \n print(f\'\\n=== NEXT STEPS ===\')\n print(f\'âœ“ Found {len(march_2021_papers)} relevant FRB papers from March 2021\')\n print(f\'âœ“ Identified {len(papers_with_xray)} papers with X-ray content\')\n print(f\'âœ“ Identified {len(papers_with_time_profile)} papers with time profile content\')\n print(f\'âœ“ Ready to analyze paper content for X-ray time profile diagrams\')\n print(f\'âœ“ Author information extracted for finding related July 2020 papers\')\n \nelse:\n print(\'\\nâš  No relevant FRB papers found from March 2021\')\n print(\'Saving all search results for further analysis\')\n \n # Save all search results for analysis\n all_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, \'arxiv_frb_search_results.json\')\n with open(all_results_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump({\n \'search_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'total_papers_found\': len(all_papers),\n \'unique_papers_count\': len(unique_papers),\n \'search_queries_used\': search_queries,\n \'sample_papers\': list(unique_papers.values())[:10] # Save first 10 for inspection\n }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n \n print(f\'All search results saved to: {all_results_file}\')\n print(\'Consider expanding date range or refining search terms\')\n\nprint(\'\\n*** ARXIV FRB SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ***\')',
"description": "This implementation properly searches arXiv for multiwavelength FRB (Fast Radio Burst) papers from March 2021, addressing the execution error from the previous attempt. The code uses the arXiv API with comprehensive search queries targeting FRB research, including terms like 'fast radio burst', 'multiwavelength', 'X-ray', and 'time profile'. It filters results by March 2021 publication dates and analyzes content relevance using keyword scoring to identify papers most likely to contain X-ray time profile diagrams. The code extracts detailed paper information including titles, authors, abstracts, arXiv IDs, and PDF URLs, then categorizes papers by key features (X-ray content, time profiles, multiwavelength observations). Results are saved to workspace files for further analysis, establishing the foundation for finding related July 2020 papers by the same authors. The implementation includes comprehensive error handling, progress reporting, and detailed feature analysis to identify the most promising candidates for containing the target visualizations.",

"code": 'import os\nimport json\nimport requests\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport time\n\nprint(\'=== ANALYZING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPER AND SEARCHING FOR JULY 2020 RELATED WORK ===\')\nprint(\'Objective: Analyze the found March 2021 paper and search for related July 2020 papers by same authors\')\nprint(\'Focus: Look for X-ray time profile diagrams and establish author connections\\n\')\n\n# First, let\'s inspect the workspace structure\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n workspace = workspace_dirs[0]\n print(f\'Using workspace directory: {workspace}\')\nelse:\n workspace = \'workspace\'\n os.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok=True)\n print(f\'Created new workspace directory: {workspace}\')\n\nprint(f\'\\nWorkspace contents:\')\nfor file in os.listdir(workspace):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f\' - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)\')\n\n# Load and inspect the March 2021 FRB papers data\nmarch_papers_file = os.path.join(workspace, \'arxiv_march_2021_frb_papers.json\')\nif os.path.exists(march_papers_file):\n print(f\'\\n=== INSPECTING MARCH 2021 FRB PAPERS DATA ===\')\n \n with open(march_papers_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n march_data = json.load(f)\n \n print(\'March 2021 data structure:\')\n for key, value in march_data.items():\n if isinstance(value, list):\n print(f\' {key}: List with {len(value)} items\')\n elif isinstance(value, dict):\n print(f\' {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys\') \n else:\n print(f\' {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {value}\')\n \n # Extract the March 2021 paper details\n march_papers = march_data.get(\'march_2021_papers\', [])\n print(f\'\\nFound {len(march_papers)} March 2021 FRB papers\')\n \n if march_papers:\n target_paper = march_papers[0] # The Nicastro et al. paper\n \n print(f\'\\n=== TARGET MARCH 2021 PAPER DETAILS ===\')\n print(f\'Title: {target_paper.get("title", "No title")}\')\n print(f\'arXiv ID: {target_paper.get("arxiv_id", "No ID")}\')\n print(f\'Published: {target_paper.get("published", "No date")}\')\n print(f\'Authors: {", ".join(target_paper.get("authors", []))}\')\n print(f\'Categories: {", ".join(target_paper.get("categories", []))}\')\n print(f\'PDF URL: {target_paper.get("pdf_url", "No URL")}\')\n print(f\'Relevance Score: {target_paper.get("relevance_score", 0)}\')\n print(f\'Has FRB terms: {target_paper.get("has_frb_terms", False)}\')\n print(f\'\\nSummary:\')\n print(target_paper.get(\'summary\', \'No summary\')[:500] + \'...\')\n \n # Extract author information for July 2020 search\n authors = target_paper.get(\'authors\', [])\n print(f\'\\n=== AUTHOR ANALYSIS FOR JULY 2020 SEARCH ===\')\n print(f\'Total authors: {len(authors)}\')\n print(\'Author list:\')\n for i, author in enumerate(authors, 1):\n print(f\' {i}. {author}\')\n \n # Prepare search terms for July 2020 papers by same authors\n primary_authors = authors[:3] # Focus on first 3 authors\n print(f\'\\nPrimary authors for July 2020 search: {", ".join(primary_authors)}\')\n \n # Download the March 2021 paper PDF for analysis\n pdf_url = target_paper.get(\'pdf_url\')\n if pdf_url:\n print(f\'\\n=== DOWNLOADING MARCH 2021 PAPER PDF ===\')\n print(f\'PDF URL: {pdf_url}\')\n \n try:\n headers = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\'\n }\n \n pdf_response = requests.get(pdf_url, headers=headers, timeout=60)\n \n if pdf_response.status_code == 200:\n pdf_filename = os.path.join(workspace, f\'march_2021_frb_paper_{target_paper.get("arxiv_id", "unknown").replace(".", "_")}.pdf\')\n \n with open(pdf_filename, \'wb\') as f:\n f.write(pdf_response.content)\n \n pdf_size = len(pdf_response.content)\n print(f\'âœ“ PDF downloaded successfully: {pdf_filename}\')\n print(f\' File size: {pdf_size:,} bytes\')\n \n # Note: For actual PDF analysis, we would need additional libraries like PyPDF2 or pdfplumber\n # For now, we\'ll focus on the text-based search approach\n \n else:\n print(f\'âœ— Failed to download PDF: HTTP {pdf_response.status_code}\')\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\'âœ— Error downloading PDF: {str(e)}\')\n \n # Now search for July 2020 papers by the same authors\n print(f\'\\n=== SEARCHING FOR JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS ===\')\n \n # arXiv API base URL\n arxiv_base_url = \'http://export.arxiv.org/api/query\'\n \n # Create search queries for each primary author\n july_2020_queries = []\n \n # Search by individual authors\n for author in primary_authors:\n # Try different name formats\n author_parts = author.split()\n if len(author_parts) >= 2:\n # Full name\n july_2020_queries.append(f\'au:"{author}"\')\n # Last name, first initial\n last_name = author_parts[-1]\n first_initial = author_parts[0][0] if author_parts[0] else \'\'\n july_2020_queries.append(f\'au:"{last_name}, {first_initial}"\')\n # Just last name (broader search)\n july_2020_queries.append(f\'au:"{last_name}"\')\n \n # Also search for combinations with FRB terms\n for author in primary_authors[:2]: # Limit to avoid too many queries\n july_2020_queries.append(f\'au:"{author}" AND (fast radio burst OR FRB)\')\n \n print(f\'Using {len(july_2020_queries)} author-based search queries\')\n \n all_july_2020_papers = []\n \n for i, query in enumerate(july_2020_queries, 1):\n print(f\'\\nSearch {i}/{len(july_2020_queries)}: "{query}"\')\n \n params = {\n \'search_query\': query,\n \'start\': 0,\n \'max_results\': 30, # Reasonable limit\n \'sortBy\': \'submittedDate\',\n \'sortOrder\': \'descending\'\n }\n \n try:\n response = requests.get(arxiv_base_url, params=params, timeout=30)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET\n \n root = ET.fromstring(response.text)\n \n namespaces = {\n \'atom\': \'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom\',\n \'arxiv\': \'http://arxiv.org/schemas/atom\'\n }\n \n entries = root.findall(\'atom:entry\', namespaces)\n print(f\' Found {len(entries)} papers\')\n \n july_2020_count = 0\n \n for entry in entries:\n # Extract paper details\n title_elem = entry.find(\'atom:title\', namespaces)\n title = title_elem.text.strip() if title_elem is not None else \'No title\'\n \n published_elem = entry.find(\'atom:published\', namespaces)\n published = published_elem.text.strip() if published_elem is not None else \'No date\'\n \n # Check if this is from July 2020\n if published.startswith(\'2020-07\'):\n july_2020_count += 1\n \n # Extract full paper details for July 2020 papers\n summary_elem = entry.find(\'atom:summary\', namespaces)\n summary = summary_elem.text.strip() if summary_elem is not None else \'No summary\'\n \n id_elem = entry.find(\'atom:id\', namespaces)\n arxiv_id = id_elem.text.strip() if id_elem is not None else \'No ID\'\n if \'arxiv.org/abs/\' in arxiv_id:\n arxiv_id = arxiv_id.split(\'/\')[-1]\n \n # Get authors\n paper_authors = []\n author_elems = entry.findall(\'atom:author\', namespaces)\n for author_elem in author_elems:\n name_elem = author_elem.find(\'atom:name\', namespaces)\n if name_elem is not None:\n paper_authors.append(name_elem.text.strip())\n \n # Get categories\n categories = []\n category_elems = entry.findall(\'atom:category\', namespaces)\n for cat_elem in category_elems:\n term = cat_elem.get(\'term\')\n if term:\n categories.append(term)\n \n july_paper = {\n \'title\': title,\n \'authors\': paper_authors,\n \'summary\': summary,\n \'published\': published,\n \'arxiv_id\': arxiv_id,\n \'pdf_url\': f\'https://arxiv.org/pdf/{arxiv_id}.pdf\',\n \'categories\': categories,\n \'search_query\': query\n }\n \n all_july_2020_papers.append(july_paper)\n \n print(f\' âœ“ July 2020 paper: "{title[:60]}..." ({arxiv_id})\')\n print(f\' Authors: {", ".join(paper_authors[:2])}{"." if len(paper_authors) > 2 else ""}\')\n \n print(f\' July 2020 papers found: {july_2020_count}\')\n \n else:\n print(f\' Error: HTTP {response.status_code}\')\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\' Exception: {str(e)}\')\n \n # Small delay between requests\n time.sleep(0.5)\n \n # Remove duplicates and analyze July 2020 papers\n unique_july_2020_papers = {}\n for paper in all_july_2020_papers:\n arxiv_id = paper[\'arxiv_id\']\n if arxiv_id not in unique_july_2020_papers:\n unique_july_2020_papers[arxiv_id] = paper\n \n july_2020_papers_list = list(unique_july_2020_papers.values())\n \n print(f\'\\n=== JULY 2020 PAPERS ANALYSIS ===\')\n print(f\'Total July 2020 papers found: {len(july_2020_papers_list)}\')\n \n if july_2020_papers_list:\n print(f\'\\n=== JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS ===\')\n \n # Check which papers have overlapping authors with the March 2021 paper\n march_authors_lower = [author.lower() for author in authors]\n related_papers = []\n \n for i, paper in enumerate(july_2020_papers_list, 1):\n paper_authors_lower = [author.lower() for author in paper.get(\'authors\', [])]\n \n # Check for author overlap\n author_overlap = any(march_author in paper_authors_lower for march_author in march_authors_lower)\n \n print(f\'\\n{i}. Title: {paper["title"]}\')\n print(f\' arXiv ID: {paper["arxiv_id"]}\')\n print(f\' Published: {paper["published"]}\')\n print(f\' Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}\')\n print(f\' Categories: {", ".join(paper.get("categories", []))}\')\n \n if author_overlap:\n print(f\' *** AUTHOR OVERLAP WITH MARCH 2021 PAPER ***\')\n related_papers.append(paper)\n \n # Check for FRB or X-ray content\n title_lower = paper[\'title\'].lower()\n summary_lower = paper.get(\'summary\', \'\').lower()\n combined_text = f\'{title_lower} {summary_lower}\'\n \n has_frb = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'fast radio burst\', \'frb\', \'radio burst\'])\n has_xray = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'x-ray\', \'xray\', \'x ray\'])\n has_time_profile = any(term in combined_text for term in [\'time profile\', \'light curve\', \'temporal\', \'timing\'])\n \n features = []\n if has_frb:\n features.append(\'FRB\')\n if has_xray:\n features.append(\'X-ray\')\n if has_time_profile:\n features.append(\'Time Profile\')\n \n if features:\n print(f\' *** FEATURES: {", ".join(features)} ***\')\n \n print(f\' Summary: {paper.get("summary", "No summary")[:200]}...\')\n \n # Save July 2020 results\n july_results = {\n \'search_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'march_2021_paper\': target_paper,\n \'july_2020_search_queries\': july_2020_queries,\n \'total_july_2020_papers\': len(july_2020_papers_list),\n \'related_papers_count\': len(related_papers),\n \'july_2020_papers\': july_2020_papers_list,\n \'related_papers\': related_papers\n }\n \n july_results_file = os.path.join(workspace, \'july_2020_related_papers.json\')\n with open(july_results_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(july_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n \n print(f\'\\nâœ“ July 2020 search results saved to: {july_results_file}\')\n \n if related_papers:\n print(f\'\\nðŸŽ¯ FOUND {len(related_papers)} RELATED JULY 2020 PAPERS BY SAME AUTHORS!\')\n print(\'These papers are candidates for containing X-ray time profile diagrams.\')\n \n for paper in related_papers:\n print(f\'\\nðŸ“„ {paper["title"]} ({paper["arxiv_id"]})\')\n print(f\' Authors: {", ".join(paper["authors"])}\')\n print(f\' Published: {paper["published"]}\')\n print(f\' PDF: {paper["pdf_url"]}\')\n else:\n print(f\'\\nâš  No July 2020 papers found with overlapping authors\')\n print(\'Consider broader search criteria or different time periods\')\n \n else:\n print(\'\\nâš  No July 2020 papers found by the same authors\')\n print(\'Consider expanding search criteria or checking different date ranges\')\n \n else:\n print(\'\\nâš  No March 2021 papers found in the data file\')\nelse:\n print(f\'\\nâš  March 2021 papers file not found: {march_papers_file}\')\n\nprint(f\'\\n=== SUMMARY ===\')\nprint(\'âœ“ Analyzed March 2021 FRB paper by Nicastro et al.\')\nprint(\'âœ“ Extracted author information for related work search\')\nprint(\'âœ“ Searched for July 2020 papers by same authors\')\nprint(\'âœ“ Ready for detailed PDF analysis of promising papers\')\nprint(\'\\n*** ANALYSIS PHASE COMPLETE ***\')',
"description": 'This implementation analyzes the successfully found March 2021 FRB paper by Nicastro et al. and searches for related July 2020 work by the same authors. The code first inspects the workspace structure and loads the March 2021 paper data, extracting detailed information including the full author list (Luciano Nicastro, Cristiano Guidorzi, Eliana Palazzi, Luca Zampieri, Massimo Turatto, Angela Gardini). It downloads the March 2021 paper PDF for potential future analysis, then systematically searches arXiv for July 2020 papers by the same authors using multiple query strategies (full names, last name + initial, last name only, and combinations with FRB terms). The code identifies papers with author overlap and analyzes their content for FRB, X-ray, and time profile features. Results are saved to workspace files, establishing connections between the March 2021 multiwavelength FRB observations paper and any related July 2020 work that might contain the target X-ray time profile diagrams. This approach builds the foundation for identifying the specific paper and visualization mentioned in the plan.',

Though several models have been proposed\nto explain the observed data, none is able to explain alone the variety of\nevents so far recorded. The leading models consider magnetars as potential FRB\nsources. The recent detection of FRBs from the galactic magnetar SGR J1935+2154\nseems to support them.
