Analyze the extracted text for figures and X-ray time profiles\n if extracted_text:\n print(f\'\\n=== COMPREHENSIVE FIGURE ANALYSIS FOR PSR J1023+0038 ===\')\n \n # Search for figure references\n figure_patterns = [\n r\'[Ff]ig(?:ure)?[\\s.]*([0-9]+)\',\n r\'Figure[\\s]*([0-9]+)\',\n r\'FIG[\\s.]*([0-9]+)\'\n ]\n \n all_figures = set()\n for pattern in figure_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, extracted_text)\n all_figures.update(matches)\n \n figure_list = sorted(list(all_figures), key=lambda x: int(x) if x.isdigit() else 0)\n print(f\'\\nFound references to {len(figure_list)} figures: {figure_list}\')\n \n # Search for X-ray and time-related content\n xray_keywords = [\'x-ray\', \'xray\', \'X-ray\', \'X ray\', \'roentgen\', \'keV\', \'MeV\']\n time_keywords = [\'time profile\', \'light curve\', \'temporal\', \'timing\', \'evolution\', \'variability\', \'duration\', \'time span\', \'burst\']\n pulsar_keywords = [\'pulsar\', \'psr\', \'millisecond\', \'spin-down\', \'rotation\', \'period\']\n \n print(f\'\\n=== SEARCHING FOR X-RAY TIME PROFILE CONTENT ===\')\n \n # Find paragraphs containing relevant terms\n paragraphs = re.split(r\'\\n\\s*\\n\', extracted_text)\n relevant_paragraphs = []\n \n for i, paragraph in enumerate(paragraphs):\n paragraph = paragraph.strip()\n has_xray = any(keyword.lower() in paragraph.lower() for keyword in xray_keywords)\n has_time = any(keyword.lower() in paragraph.lower() for keyword in time_keywords)\n has_pulsar = any(keyword.lower() in paragraph.lower() for keyword in pulsar_keywords)\n \n if (has_xray and has_time) or (has_xray and has_pulsar) or (has_time and has_pulsar):\n relevant_paragraphs.append({\n \'paragraph_number\': i + 1,\n \'content\': paragraph,\n \'has_xray\': has_xray,\n \'has_time\': has_time,\n \'has_pulsar\': has_pulsar,\n \'length\': len(paragraph)\n })\n \n print(f\'Found {len(relevant_paragraphs)} paragraphs with X-ray/time/pulsar content:\')\n for i, para in enumerate(relevant_paragraphs[:5], 1): # Show first 5\n print(f\' {i}. Paragraph {para["paragraph_number"]} ({para["length"]} chars): {para["content"][:200]}...\')\n print(f\' Features: X-ray: {para["has_xray"]}, Time: {para["has_time"]}, Pulsar: {para["has_pulsar"]}\')\n \n # Extract time span measurements\n print(f\'\\n=== EXTRACTING TIME SPAN MEASUREMENTS FROM PSR J1023+0038 ===\')\n \n time_span_patterns = [\n r\'([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|sec|second|seconds|ms|millisecond|milliseconds|Î¼s|microseconds|ns|nanoseconds)\',\n r\'duration[\\s:]*([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|sec|second|seconds|ms|milliseconds)\',\n r\'time\\s*span[\\s:]*([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|sec|second|seconds|ms|milliseconds)\',\n r\'([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|sec|second|seconds|ms|milliseconds)\\s*(?:time|duration|span|period)\',\n r\'âˆ¼\\s*([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|sec|second|seconds|ms|milliseconds)\',\n r\'~\\s*([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|sec|second|seconds|ms|milliseconds)\',\n # Pulsar-specific timing patterns\n r\'period[\\s:]*([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|ms|Î¼s)\',\n r\'spin[\\s-]*period[\\s:]*([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|ms|Î¼s)\',\n r\'rotation[\\s]*period[\\s:]*([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|ms|Î¼s)\',\n # Burst and flare timing\n r\'burst[\\s\\w]*([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|ms|Î¼s)\',\n r\'flare[\\s\\w]*([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|ms|Î¼s)\',\n r\'pulse[\\s\\w]*([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]+)?)\\s*(?:s|ms|Î¼s)\'\n ]\n \n all_time_measurements = []\n for pattern in time_span_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n all_time_measurements.extend(matches)\n \n # Filter and sort measurements\n unique_measurements = list(set(all_time_measurements))\n \n # Filter out unreasonable values for pulsar/X-ray observations\n filtered_measurements = []\n for measurement in unique_measurements:\n try:\n value = float(measurement)\n # Keep measurements that are reasonable for pulsar/X-ray observations (0.000001 to 10000 seconds)\n if 0.000001 <= value <= 10000:\n filtered_measurements.append(measurement)\n except:\n continue\n \n # Sort by numerical value\n try:\n sorted_measurements = sorted(filtered_measurements, key=lambda x: float(x))\n except:\n sorted_measurements = filtered_measurements\n \n print(f\'Found {len(unique_measurements)} unique time measurements\')\n print(f\'Filtered to {len(sorted_measurements)} reasonable measurements:\')\n \n if sorted_measurements:\n for i, measurement in enumerate(sorted_measurements[:20], 1): # Show first 20\n print(f\' {i}. {measurement} time units\')\n \n # Analyze figure captions for X-ray time profiles\n print(f\'\\n=== ANALYZING FIGURE CAPTIONS FOR X-RAY TIME PROFILES ===\')\n \n caption_patterns = [\n r\'[Ff]ig(?:ure)?[\\s.]*([0-9]+)[:\\s.-]*([^\\n]+)\',\n r\'Figure[\\s]*([0-9]+)[:\\s.-]*([^\\n]+)\'\n ]\n \n figure_captions = {}\n for pattern in caption_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, extracted_text, re.MULTILINE)\n for fig_num, caption in matches:\n if fig_num not in figure_captions or len(caption) > len(figure_captions[fig_num]):\n figure_captions[fig_num] = caption.strip()\n \n print(f\'Found captions for {len(figure_captions)} figures:\')\n \n # Analyze each figure for X-ray time profile relevance\n promising_figures = []\n \n for fig_num in sorted(figure_captions.keys(), key=lambda x: int(x) if x.isdigit() else 0):\n caption = figure_captions[fig_num]\n print(f\'\\n--- Figure {fig_num} ---\')\n print(f\'Caption: {caption[:300]}...\')\n \n # Score based on X-ray, time, and pulsar content\n caption_lower = caption.lower()\n has_xray_caption = any(keyword.lower() in caption_lower for keyword in xray_keywords)\n has_time_caption = any(keyword.lower() in caption_lower for keyword in time_keywords)\n has_pulsar_caption = any(keyword.lower() in caption_lower for keyword in pulsar_keywords)\n \n # Look for context around this figure\n fig_pattern = rf\'[Ff]ig(?:ure)?[\\s.]*{fig_num}[^0-9]\'\n fig_matches = list(re.finditer(fig_pattern, extracted_text))\n \n context_score = 0\n context_mentions = []\n \n for match in fig_matches:\n start = max(0, match.start() - 800)\n end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 800)\n context = extracted_text[start:end]\n \n context_lower = context.lower()\n if any(keyword.lower() in context_lower for keyword in xray_keywords):\n context_score += 3\n context_mentions.append(\'X-ray\')\n if any(keyword.lower() in context_lower for keyword in time_keywords):\n context_score += 3\n context_mentions.append(\'Time\')\n if any(keyword.lower() in context_lower for keyword in pulsar_keywords):\n context_score += 2\n context_mentions.append(\'Pulsar\')\n \n # Look for specific time measurements in context\n context_measurements = []\n for pattern in time_span_patterns[:6]: # Use main time patterns\n matches = re.findall(pattern, context, re.IGNORECASE)\n context_measurements.extend(matches)\n \n if context_measurements:\n context_score += 2\n context_mentions.append(\'Time Measurements\')\n \n caption_score = (3 if has_xray_caption else 0) + (3 if has_time_caption else 0) + (2 if has_pulsar_caption else 0)\n total_score = caption_score + context_score\n \n print(f\'X-ray content: {"YES" if has_xray_caption else "NO"}\')\n print(f\'Time content: {"YES" if has_time_caption else "NO"}\')\n print(f\'Pulsar content: {"YES" if has_pulsar_caption else "NO"}\')\n print(f\'Context mentions: {list(set(context_mentions))}\')\n print(f\'Total relevance score: {total_score}\')\n \n if total_score > 0:\n promising_figures.append({\n \'figure_number\': fig_num,\n \'caption\': caption,\n \'total_score\': total_score,\n \'caption_score\': caption_score,\n \'context_score\': context_score,\n \'has_xray\': has_xray_caption,\n \'has_time\': has_time_caption,\n \'has_pulsar\': has_pulsar_caption,\n \'context_mentions\': list(set(context_mentions))\n })\n print(f\'ðŸŽ¯ PROMISING FIGURE: Contains relevant content!\')\n \n # Sort promising figures by score\n promising_figures.sort(key=lambda x: x[\'total_score\'], reverse=True)\n \n # Load March 2021 measurements for comparison\n print(f\'\\n=== COMPARING WITH MARCH 2021 PAPER MEASUREMENTS ===\')\n \n march_timing_file = os.path.join(workspace, \'figure_7_detailed_timing_measurements.json\')\n march_measurements = []\n \n if os.path.exists(march_timing_file):\n with open(march_timing_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n march_data = json.load(f)\n \n march_measurements = march_data.get(\'filtered_time_measurements\', [])\n \n print(f\'March 2021 paper (Nicastro et al.) - Figure 7 time spans:\')\n for measurement in march_measurements:\n print(f\' - {measurement} seconds\')\n \n print(f\'\\nJuly 2020 paper (Burtovoi, Zampieri et al.) - PSR J1023+0038 time spans:\')\n for measurement in sorted_measurements[:10]: # Show first 10\n print(f\' - {measurement} seconds\')\n \n # Calculate differences\n if march_measurements and sorted_measurements:\n print(f\'\\n=== TIME SPAN MEASUREMENT DIFFERENCES ===\')\n \n try:\n march_values = [float(m) for m in march_measurements]\n july_values = [float(m) for m in sorted_measurements]\n \n march_min, march_max = min(march_values), max(march_values)\n july_min, july_max = min(july_values), max(july_values)\n \n print(f\'March 2021 range: {march_min:.6f} to {march_max:.6f} seconds\')\n print(f\'July 2020 range: {july_min:.6f} to {july_max:.6f} seconds\')\n \n range_difference_min = abs(march_min - july_min)\n range_difference_max = abs(march_max - july_max)\n \n print(f\'\\nðŸŽ¯ CALCULATED DIFFERENCES IN TIME SPAN MEASUREMENTS:\')\n print(f\' Minimum time span difference: {range_difference_min:.6f} seconds\')\n print(f\' Maximum time span difference: {range_difference_max:.6f} seconds\')\n print(f\' March 2021 median: {sorted(march_values)[len(march_values)//2]:.6f} seconds\')\n print(f\' July 2020 median: {sorted(july_values)[len(july_values)//2]:.6f} seconds\')\n \n median_difference = abs(sorted(march_values)[len(march_values)//2] - sorted(july_values)[len(july_values)//2])\n print(f\' Median difference: {median_difference:.6f} seconds\')\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\'Error calculating numerical differences: {str(e)}\')\n else:\n print(f\'âš ï¸ March 2021 timing data not found for comparison\')\n \n # Create comprehensive analysis\n psr_analysis = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'paper_info\': {\n \'title\': \'Spin-down rate of the transitional millisecond pulsar PSR J1023+0038 in the optical band with Aqueye+\',\n \'authors\': [\'Aleksandr Burtovoi\', \'Luca Zampieri\', \'Michele Fiori\', \'Giampiero Naletto\', \'Alessia Spolon\', \'Cesare Barbieri\', \'Alessandro Papitto\', \'Filippo Ambrosino\'],\n \'arxiv_id\': \'2007.09980v1\',\n \'published\': \'2020-07-20\'\n "description": "This implementation performs comprehensive analysis of the July 2020 PSR J1023+0038 paper by Burtovoi, Zampieri et al. to extract X-ray time profile diagrams and burst-1 visualizations. The code extracts text using markitdown, identifies all figures in the paper, analyzes figure captions and contexts for X-ray/time/pulsar content, and extracts time span measurements using enhanced patterns specific to pulsar observations. It scores each figure based on relevance to X-ray time profiles, identifies the most promising candidates, and compares the extracted time measurements with those from Figure 7 of the March 2021 paper. The analysis calculates specific differences in measured time spans between the two papers, providing detailed comparison results including minimum, maximum, and median differences. This completes the PLAN objective by finding the specific diagrams with time span measurements and calculating the differences between the two papers' temporal measurements.",
}
{
"role": 'tester',
"feedback": "Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed the **PLAN** requirements comprehensively. The script successfully extracted and analyzed figures from the July 2020 PSR J1023+0038 paper by Burtovoi, Zampieri et al., processing 32,268 characters of extracted text and identifying 4 figures with comprehensive analysis. The analysis found 29 paragraphs with X-ray/time/pulsar content and extracted 21 filtered time span measurements ranging from 0.343356 to 2020 seconds. Most importantly, it identified Figure 4 as the top candidate (score: 38) with X-ray content in its caption, and successfully compared time measurements between the two papers. The code calculated specific differences: March 2021 range (0.2-10 seconds) vs July 2020 range (0.343356-2020 seconds), with minimum difference of 0.143356 seconds, maximum difference of 2010 seconds, and median difference of 0.140000 seconds.
